Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - idealy situated in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: jlm4321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the center of Paris - walking distance to the Seine. The staff and the welcome were perfect - and the room was fanastic - quiet and spacious

Reviews.Title: “There may be better hotels in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: mbaNYC
Reviews.Content: Maybe. We don't know that, nor are we particularly interested in finding out. The Aubusson is everything we could possibly want...nice, clean rooms, a great location, a nice breakfast spread, and live music in the cafe downstairs. But the best feature is it's amazing staff. Jean and Audrey stand out, but everyone...from the front desk to the Housekeeping staff...is truly first class. This was our fifth stay at the Aubusson, and it will not be our last.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely week at Hotel d'Aubusson. We wanted to go to a luxurious Paris hotel, but didn't want a large hotel. Yet, I was somewhat hesitant about a small hotel, fearing that it might be worn or without some of the niceties we desired for our 40th anniversary. We read many reviews and decided on Hotel d'Aubusson, and I'm delighted that we did. The hotel is extremely charming, and everything is very well cared for and up to date. For example, we watched a woman employee freshen up the paint on the outdoor chairs and tables over the course of three days, which are in a small courtyard and is the only place in the hotel where smoking is permitted. Everything looked as though it were just redone, except the charming, old ceiling beams which are throughout the hotel.Our junior suite was a nice size, with flat screen TV, mini bar, a king size bed, which was very comfortable, and a lovely, generous, marble bathroom. The courtesy toiletries were by Hermes and the service was absolutely perfect. Everyone at the hotel spoke English, with Royce, who greeted us upon arrival and showed us our room, having been born in America and who spoke with an American accent, when he was not speaking impeccable French. He, Audrey and all the staff were as helpful and accomodating as they could be, and we felt 100% comfortable and at home. The head concierge, whose name I believe is Jean Vernaz, was also very helpful. He is very pleasant and had a contagious smile and sense of good cheer. We opted for the breakfast option at the hotel, which was a very good buffet of eggs, bacon (the best I've ever had), sausage, a variety of croissants, toast, cheeses, fruit, cereal and other items, and is offered from 7:30AM to 11:30AM, so you don't have to get up early to enjoy the breakfast. We arrived a couple of times at 11:15AM and the buffet was fully stocked and we were not hurried at all. There is a cafe which offers a jazz quartet on Saturday, which was excellent, and other music entertainment Wednesday through Friday. Quite frankly, we almost didn't go to the hotel because of the jazz, as one review indicated it could be noisy. Not only did we not hear it from our room (309), but we actually were disappointed that the live music was not there Sunday through Wednesday, as we found all the entertainers excellent and it was very pleasing to have this available at the hotel. In all, I believe anyone who is looking for a small, elegant, luxurious, friendly hotel will find Hotel d"Aubusson perfect. And, I should add that the neighborhood is full of small shops, restaurants, cafes and art galleries. We walked to the Musee d'Orsay (perhaps 15-20 minutes), and did not take the metro once, as we had to do several years ago when we stayed closer to the Champs Elysee. If we return to Paris, there is no doubt that we will again stay at Hotel d'Aubusson. My compliments to the management and staff of this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mjruch
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful oasis! This hotel is quiet and extremely comfortable. The beds were great, there were enough fluffy pillows, our bathroom was spacious with an enormous tub, walk-in shower, and DOUBLE sinks ( a real plus, since I was sharing a room with a childhood friend)! The room was cleaned daily, and each evening we came home to a new little gift--macarons, chocolates, etc. The bar and salon were great, especially the salon, which had a real, wood burning fireplace and several grouped seating areas with period furniture. The salon is located in the old, former monastery part of the hotel. Fresh flowers abounded. The complimentary breakfast offered scrambled eggs, bacon (a little on the limp side), sausage, beans (not a staple at an American table), various breads, pastries, wonderful cheeses, fresh fruit, tomatoes, spreads, pancakes, fresh juices, coffee, and more! GRAND by European standards. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful or polite. Royce, in particular, was so nice to us. Having grown up in the States with one French parent, he was just what we needed to help us navigate a couple of problems that required a multi-lingual approach and panache! They were all multi-lingual and were great with directions, suggestions and general assistance. The location of the hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Pont Neuf; therefore, the Louvre, Notre Dame (and all the sights on the islands) were within easy walking distance. (Crossing the Seine on the Pont Neuf is about the distance of a city block--not like crossing the Mississippi River from Tennessee to Arkansas--so if this is your first trip to Paris, don't let the map take on gigantic proportions in your mind.) We were also only a few blocks from the metro, which is easy to navigate and felt very safe. Also, just a couple of blocks down the street is the charming and very historic (1693) restaurant, Le Procope! Have your cameras ready and go with a healthy appetite. We stayed at Hotel d'Aubusson in the middle of March and enjoyed their special winter rates. Splitting the room made it more affordable, and our junior suite (think that is what is was called) was flat-out spacious compared to other places I've stayed! Like a good old American hotel, like H.I. or Hyatt, but with a better bathroom! ONLY complaint about the hotel was that sometimes--not every time--it took 10 minutes or so for the hot water to reach the fifth floor! This place is just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Super high end, super quiet, super convenient”
Reviews.Author: seave
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson. One of the most convenient locations (for what we like to do) in Paris -- Right by the Pont Neuf, so easy access to both banks. The hotel is on a pretty busy street, but they have double windows, so even our room, which was on the second floor, and on the street was silent. All the finishes and the fittings were top rate, and lots of great wardrobes to hide away all the suitcases, dirty laundry, etc. One of the nicest things in the lobby was the courtyard, surrounded on all sides by the hotel. They have a great big umbrella that covers the whole thing -- and in inclement weather, they open it, so you can still sit outside. Also, great jazz in the bar in the hotel every night. Terrific hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 10 year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel38
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and loved it. We were very lucky to get such mild weather in February. The only thing was the heat in our room was a bit much and could not be adjusted but they moved us to another room which was great. The staff is wonderful, everyone was so helpful and kind. Their breakfast was wonderful! Everything you could want in a breakfast and in such a nice room too. Their wine hour was something we looked forward to every day. The concierge staff was so wonderful booking dinners for us. We had the romance package which included breakfast, wine hour every day, a rivercruise of the Sienne and free tickets to your choice of either the Louvre or D'Orsay, a tea time service and a one way transfer to the airport. It was a great value. We will return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChrisB1949
Reviews.Content: We are about to revisit Hotel d'Aubusson for the fourth time. As frequent visitors to Paris over the last 30 years we have stayed at many places, but since we found the d'Aubusson, we never stay anywhere else. Great friendly staff throughout, beautifully presented interiors, great bar, nice breakfast in a great room, lovely lounge , nice little courtyard etc etc. The position is perfect for our interests, food, books, fashion, art, antiques, bars etc It is expensive but worth every euro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- great location & service”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJerseygirl
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Hotel d'Aubusson was just terrific. The winter promotion package was a terrific value as well. We actually did not get to use all of the 'perks', but it included free breakfast, an afternoon tea and wine hour daily plus a Siene boat ride and admission to the Louvre. The room was well appointed. The staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful with excellent service. We appreciated the complimentary water, use of umbrellas, shopping bags and Herme toiletries. The location was in the heart of St. Germaine and very accessible. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service for a romantic break”
Reviews.Author: buzz86
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and as before it was perfect for the short break we wanted. Both time we have stayed our rooms have been upgraded and the staff have been wonderful. The reems are very clean and serviced twice a day with lots of toiletries and towels available for use. On this our latest stay we were even provided with slippers to make the use of the cold tiled bathroom more acceptable. The included breakfast was up to standard with all we wanted served in the room or in the downstairs restaurant. We hope to be able to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fun find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelCriticIntl
Reviews.Content: Great neighborhood, all you need is here. The outstanding thing about the hotel is that it has lots of seating areas (outside and in) to hang out . I've stayed several times and each room was super clean and comfy, though I would say the rooms are large by Paris standards. Staff is very efficient. I have found the package rates to be the better deal, especially the one with the car pickup from the airport. This one is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Ozlord
Reviews.Content: A hotel with character, excellent staff in a great location close to the heart of St Germain. A great find.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place We Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FGM-VA
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hotel d'Aubusson for the third time this past November. On earlier visits to Paris, we had stayed at different hotels each time, but since finding the d'Aubusson we haven't stayed anywhere else. The staff is always unfailingly polite and helpful. There was a misunderstanding about which rooms have king beds, and I mistakenly booked a room with a double bed, but when I talked to the front desk staff they were so nice. They were able to move us to a larger room w/ a king bed at no additional cost. We also had a note welcoming us back, w/ a bottle of champagne, when we returned to our room after dinner that night. The concierge was a great help in confirming dinner reservations, via email exchanges before we arrived and in person during our stay. I also want to note that even the rooms facing the rue Dauphine are very quiet. I am a light sleeper, so a quiet room is important to me. The sound proofing is so good that you never hear street noise. The bar off the lobby has such a warm, cozy atmosphere. My husband and I enjoyed having a drink there before dinner in the evening, before it got crowded w/ people enjoying the life music. We will try to spend more time there on our next visit! One practical tip, especially for women--the hair dryers in the rooms are really difficult to use for styling your hair. Rather than an on/off switch, you have to keep a button on the handle pushed in for it to be "on". Try to mimic this the next time you are styling your hair w/ a blow dryer, with a brush in one hand, and you will quickly see how painful/impossible it is. The dryer turns off everytime you move your hand. Bring a little dual voltage travel dryer if this is important to you. Our thanks and appreciation to all the staff. We look forward to many return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the Left Bank, cozy bar and reception area, room on the smallish side (but that's usual in Paris) facing the street (excellent insulation). Jazz concerts can be annoying, if you don't like that kind of music or if you're in the mood for an early sleep. Private garage at a reasonable daily rate. Overall, good value for money (if you get a good rate).

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ANSH90210
Reviews.Content: We booked a loft suite, queen bed, living room wh bedroom upstairs at D'Aubusson and when we arrived, we were down a family room, 10' X 12', double bed, with a 6' X 10' loft with a single bed and a big fan. When we complained, we were told it was the only room left, holiday season and all that. Two of us couldn't walk around the room at the same time. All this for 515 Euros. When we checked out a few days later and asked for a rate adjustment, we were met with a Gaelic shrug. However, to their credit, after a howl from our travel agent, they graciously refunded our stay. Public rooms were lovely and location superb, but be careful what you bet.

Reviews.Title: “Still good except for conciergerie”
Reviews.Author: Honeygatherer
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hotel. My wife and I were arriving and leaving by different flights. The Hotel had a Winter Package whereby a one way transfer from the airport was included. I sent no less than 6 successive e mails explaining that we wanted to use this for my wife's drop to the airport . Each time they got it wrong and arranged the limo for my pick up/departure /her pick up. Everything but what we were very clearly asking for . Secondly, another person in the Concierge -an American , seemed to have an attitude for some inexplicable reason. Thirdly,We stayed for 6 nights- on the last night - there was only 1 person at the Reception and the Printer was out of paper. I wanted to print my web check in, but this 1 person was missing for an hour, leaving the Reception totally unmanned. I was told that he was attending to someone's Room Service order . Other than the above, the Hotel still continues to be good and worth staying in, if one wants to stay on the Left Bank

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: Feeber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a recent trip to France. I had booked some time ahead and dealt with the concierge on a few restaurants and he did a great job with local recommendations around the Christmas period. His responses were fast and always very polite and helpful. When we arrived, the staff were also very helpful. Curiously, the bar staff were very friendly but took ages to take orders and to take away the empties at times. The hotel itself is in walking distance to the Seine, Notre Dame (good for dawn and sunset photography) and lots of other places and is in a really nice part of Paris. We were there over Christmas and it was busy but I did get the sense that many people around were locals. Checkin was easy and all in order. The room was really large and easily accomodated a big main bed and room for a rollaway for our daughter. The bathroom was also a decent size. The room was cleaned every day and was very tidy. Breakfast was excellent, with a range of cold and hot foods and very yummy pastries! It was on the expensive side at EUR25 each but on an "all you can eat" basis. The breakfast room was really nice. There was also a bar and a nice sitting area for afternoon tea with an old style Parisian look. We have not stayed twice in the same hotel in Paris, partly due to the choice available, but we will definitely stay here again. It's not cheap at all but it really is a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable first rate hotel on left bank”
Reviews.Author: MissmydoginCT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aubusson in March 2011, my third visit in three years. The hotel is in a great location on famous Rue Dauphine, steps from the Siene, St Germain, St Michel, Notre Dame, Louvre and all the charming small streets, boutiques and restaurants that make this area of Paris one of the most interesting and lively areas in the city. The hotel is traditional in decor but light and spacious common rooms and garden are very inviting. The jazz bar on the first floor sets a sophisticated atmosphere and the breakfast room is like this in hotels you find in the Provence countryside. Service is very professional and friendly. Seems to be very popular with Americans and Brits. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and well appointed. Prices are a little steep but I have had so many disappointments in other hotels in this area with similar rates, I am willing to pay the price to be confident of a wonderful stay. Obviously others agree with me. It can be difficult booking a room at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: CaboMica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September and fell in love with the hotel. it's so special. The staff is lovely and very helpful. The location is perfect for walking everywhere and close to wonderful restaurants and shopping. We sat outside in their charming courtyard where we enjoyed champagne and delicious nibbles. There is a lovely delicious breakfast served either inside or outside. The rooms are a good size and a terrific bathroom with great products. We are getting ready to book for September for my birthday & I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BruceAMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 different occasions over the course of 12 days and absolutely loved everything about it. The rooms were large for Paris standards, the staff was excellent and the location was perfect, walking minutes to everything in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: alijj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day and need to say that the Hotel D'Aubusson was just a wonderful hotel. As most everyone has commented -- the location was perfect - all the staff we dealt with were superb. From the amenities brought to our room to the excellent help from the front desk. All outstanding and greatly appreciated. We used room service 2x and it too was efficient. So except for dreary weather - this hotel made our Paris trip as beautiful as ever.

Reviews.Title: “try any other hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haim S
Reviews.Content: the price of 475 Euro for room 206 which is absolut a standart room is a very poor value for your money.I will never return to this hotel..........

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anna G
Reviews.Content: After going to Paris for several years and trying out most of the hotels in the 6 th arrondissement, we finally found the almost perfect hotel in the Aubusson. It was like the tale of Goldie Locks. There was always something wrong with other hotels, until we found Hotel d'Aubusson on Rue Dauphine. My husband and I just adore this place. Our room was up to date and quite elegant, wonderful bathroom, and very comfortable beds. We enjoyed sitting with our Paris friends in the huge salon with a great big fireplace, and listening to the music at the bar area. Great location. Cross the bridge and you are on the right bank. Lots of wonderful restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: K-traveler13
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this is an excellent hotel. The rooms are nice-sized by Paris standards, clean and comfortable, service is excellent and breakfast is good (but not as good as it once was). The location in the heart of St. Germain can't be beat and the jazz lounge is very popular with guests and locals as well. Our criticism focuses on room value. We booked a deluxe room on a summer package at 395 euros a night for four nights. Upon check-in, we were taken to a two level room--bathroom and living area on the first level and king-sized bed in the loft. Due to the extremely low ceiling in the loft, I knew that at 6'1'' I was at serious risk of bumping my head, especially getting out of bed. So we rejected the room. No problem. We were transferred immediately to another room, less spacious but nice enough. Suffering from jet lag, we simply assumed that this was a "deluxe" room too. Our stay was enjoyable. Paris was our first destination on a fifteen day trip. It was also our final destination. During the trip, we decided to return to the d'Aubusson for our final night. We booked a "superior" room on the summer package at 280 euros. Curiously, our superior room was larger than our deluxe room two weeks earlier. In fairness, our first room had a nicer bathroom but not 115 euros/night nicer--not by a long shot. Even considering the possibility that prices were a little higher in early July than late July, this huge price differential for practically the same room is troubling. So, before booking a room reservation at the d'Aubusson--which we still recommend--call or email the hotel to determine the difference in size and amenities for superior versus deluxe room. If our most recent experience is typical, you should be perfectly happy in the lowest-priced superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: vmb
Reviews.Content: Having tried several different hotels and apartments in the 6th and 7th, we most recently stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson (6th) which fast became our new favorite! Rooms are reasonably sized, clean and very comfortable. The staff is welcoming and the location, just a few short blocks from the Sienne, can't be beat. The lounge features live jazz with various artists appearing several nights per week. We especially enjoyed the outdoor center couryard for pre and post dinner drinks with friends. In fact, our only objection is that smoking is permitted in the courtyard. We wish that policy would change. Breakfast is also served in the courtyard, weather permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jfm57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night before going on a barge trip. We stayed at a more expensive hotel at the other end of the trip in the area near the Arc de Triumphe and we regretted that we did not come back here. My husband and I loved d'Aubusson. The staff were more than accommodating, the rooms large and comfortable and clean. The location was on a nice quiet street in a very centrally located area. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: LUDH
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after a wonderful trip to Paris 10/21-10/29/2011. After alot of research, asking friends, and scouring tripadvisor we decided to stay at the Hotel d'Aubusson on the Rue Dauphine in the St. Germain des Pres. I think this decision was the best of many we made but definitely enhanced our trip more than we expected. I'm sure you have already read that the hotel is immaculate, the beds were comfortable, the bathrooms updated and etc etc. What really made our trip was the staff. Royce, Jean, Coralee and Audrey are first class!! They are all friendly, accomodating and provide some excellent recommendations. When the Musee D'Orsay was on strike (as I hear happens quite often!) Jean recommended the Marmotten Monet, a small lesser known Impressionist museum on the outskirts of Paris. It was an easy bus ride across town and it was very impressive. We loved it. Ask Royce for restaurant recommendations-they were both great! They all helped us with our very weak french so that we could navigate Paris much better. My husband especially loved Cafe Laurent. The music was terrific and Laurent is the consommate host. Thank you to everyone at Hotel d'Aubusson we hope that we will be able to visit you all again soon! Beintot! The Simons

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in so many ways...”
Reviews.Author: T and J E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights in Sept 2011. We found the front desk staff to be the most knowledgeable, helpful and truly friendly. Simple requests such as dinner reserations to the tough one of getting a taxi in the rain were met with a smile and success. Location was perfect for a walking tour of Paris. The major museums are within close walking distance. Great bakery just up the street and cafes abound. Keep in mind there is no better bar or bartender than in the bar/garden of the hotel. Our room was very comfortable with a huge shower, which made it all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Solaqne71
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a central location, staff is wonderful and very helpful at getting reservations, laundry, room service, breakfast, etc. Cozy bar in corner. Quiet, only 54 rooms but a real treat afte we had stayed a more expensive places in Rome and Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the Saint Germaine section”
Reviews.Author: Seine7
Reviews.Content: In May of 2011, my friend and I were having dinner at the restaurant associated with the Relais St. Germain and we met the wife of the manager of this hotel, Mrs. Spove. During dinner, I mentioned to Mrs. Spove that we were staying at the Relais St. Germaine. She then suggested that we check out the hotel her husband manages, the Hotel D'Aubusson. So, we decided to do just that in our return trip in October 2011. We loved staying at this hotel more than the Relais St. Germain for several reasons. 1) The Service at the reception area is outstanding. They are always friendly and patient versus sometimes cold and rude at the Relais St. Germain. Here 's an example of this hotel's patience. They helped me several times in getting. files to print on several different occasions. Service is always greeted with a smile. 2) Hermes bath products are used at the Hotel d' Aubusson and replenished daily. The Relais St. Germaine uses a less standard brand and does not replenish them daily. 3) The bathroom in the Hotel d'Aubusson is larger and more modern than the Relais St. Germain. 4) The Hotel d'Aubusson offers promotions that are a great value. 5) The rooms are more tastefully decorated that gives you a Paris feeling versus at the Relais St. Germaine the decor is too busy. 6) The beds are more comfortable and the rooms are larger at this hotel. 7) The jazz bar at this location is the best. It's nice to come back after sightseeing and having a nice dinner to hear the wonderful music at the jazz bar. It makes the night end on a perfect note. So, thank you Mrs. Spove for recommending this hotel and our new favorite place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: KaitlinS
Reviews.Content: We arrived early from our flight and were told our room was ready! A cheerful and efficient staff and a nicely appointed room with all the amenities and a large bathroom by Paris standards. The hotel has a charming courtyard and a wonderful piano bar which contributes to the lovely atmosphere in this hotel. The only word of caution is that if you are early to bed be sure to reserve your room away from the piano bar.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of vibrant Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: Annejs
Reviews.Content: Window boxes full of cheerful red geraniums welcomed us to Hotel d'Aubusson in the heart of Saint Germain. We arrived some hours before our scheduled check-in time, expecting to leave our bags and return later in the day. We were pleasantly surprised when we were invited to have a coffee in the lounge while we waited just ten minutes for our room to be available. The staff was very friendly and helpful, in particular the front desk and concierge service. Our room was large by Paris standards and overlooked a pretty private courtyard. The room and bathroom were well equipped, attractively decorated and spotlessly clean. Hermes toiletries and fresh flowers added a special touch. The dining and lounge areas were very welcoming with attractive furnishings, high ceilings and an inviting atmosphere. An option for a continental breakfast, rather than a full English breakfast, would be an asset, but there are numerous cafes within very close proximity, where lighter breakfasts are readily available. The bar areas, both outdoor and indoor had a fabulous atmosphere and the free jazz of an evening was fabulous! We loved being able to enjoy a drink and the music both before going out to dinner and upon returning later in the evening. Hotel d'Aubusson is tucked away on the quieter Rue Dauphine and within walking distance of the main sights of Paris. A short walk to the relaxing Seine in one direction and the vibrant Boulevarde Saint Germain in the other, and surrounded by fabulous brasseries, market stalls and boutiques, this hotel is in a fantastic location. Outstanding staff, a welcoming atmosphere and extremely comfortable rooms make this hotel a brilliant find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Csora2547
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. Close to everything. There are lots of restaurants in the area, and only a block away from the Seine river. The hotel staff was very helpful with directions and arranging anything we needed. We did have a problem on Friday night though. Our room was at the front of the hotel across the street from a very active bar. The air conditioner went out and we had to leave the window open. Although I enjoyed the music, I did not enjoy hearing it until 2 AM! The hotel staff said the air conditioner went back on at 11 PM but we weren't aware of it. They did give us a discount for the inconvenience and that was appreciated. The rooms have double windows and when they are closed I did NOT hear any street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKatie2
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location for this hotel! Right in the heart of charming Saint Germain - close to all of the cafe's, shopping, and the Seine. The hotel staff was always helpful, especially the Jean - the chef concierge - who made our dinner reservation each night and did a fantastic job. The room size was large for Paris, which was a pleasant surprise and the hotel bar with the evening Jazz was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book Room 104 If You Want An Early Sleep”
Reviews.Author: travels46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, and the staff is even better. We were put in room 104, which is directly above the live jazz bar. The music continued late into the night and had we not liked jazz, it would have been difficult for us. That said, everything else about the room was fine, including it's size. The hotel is wonderfully located. There are dozens of great small restaurants within a few blocks. It's a real "left bank" place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: dennburr
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Aubusson, and it didn't disappoint us. The welcome is warm, and the service is impeccable. The hotel is small as are the rooms, but everything is well put together, and our room had been recently updated. The bedding, towels, soaps (Hermes) etc., are top quality, and we received champagne upon arrival. One of the best features ( for any hotel) is the speed at which the rooms are turned over, and d'Aubusson said our room would be ready within thirty minutes of our arrival ( overnight from NY), and it really was - well done! The front office staff and concierges could not have been more helpful with calls, wifi, taxis etc. Nothing was too much trouble. The charming Cafe Laurent on the ground floor is a perfect place to sip and listen to jazz and prepare for a night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lbrown2304
Reviews.Content: Tonight is our last night in Paris We have been at the Hotel d'Aubusson for 4 nights. What a great choice. The location is perfect. Two blocks from the Seine and across from the Louvre. The hotel is small, quiet and has a fabulous staff. We booked the Romance package which came with a delicious breakfast each day, a concert at Saint Chappelle, river cruise and a bottle of champagne with@ pate', fig preserves etc. We are very close to Rue Saint-Germain with all if it's wonderful shops. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants. The bartender, Favien, was so wonderful. Also, Jean at the front desk attended to our every need. Anyone who does not love the wonderful French people, have not had the pleasure of meeting this gracious staff. Right across the street from the hotel is a fantastic Thai massage spa. I had the best 75 minute reflexology session ever. It was perfect too after a busy day of walking and sightseeing. We will return here fore sure next time we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel but you could do better for less money.”
Reviews.Author: Snorkleboy00820
Reviews.Content: A friend had recommended this place and we stayed there for one week. The staff was very helpful and we found it close to everything we wanted to see or do. Our room was rather small, and being in the front of the hotel on Rue Dauphine, it was also rather noisy 24/7. The one thing we didn't like was that it was hot and the central AC was not very effective making sleeping a challenge in mid-September. We asked the staff to check it and they did but alas there was no improvement. It was very clean with a little bar downstairs with music most nights when we returned from dinner. It was also very expensive. Next time we will probably stay on the other side of the river in Marais, or (for the same money as this place) stay on Ile de la Cite which is much quieter. So overall it was pleasant and conveniently located, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SAC1956
Reviews.Content: The online reviews for this hotel were very important to us in making our choice of where to stay for our special week in Paris. The choice was entirely successful - you should trust the positive reviews. The staff, location and overall quality of this hotel are exceptional. The full breakfast is much to their favor. We were most grateful that the hotel honored our request for a quiet room on an upper floor. We urge you to carefully consider opting for one of their packages. The Romance Package significantly enhanced the pleasure and the value of our stay. We have stayed in many hotels in a variety of locations in Paris over the last 50 years. This hotel will be our choice for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Hotel With an Incredible Jazz Club on The Weekends to boot!”
Reviews.Author: jdb44
Reviews.Content: The Hotel D'Aubusson is wonderful in so many ways; everything positive you've heard or read is absolutely true... But come the weekend, at the strike of nine..Laurent's Cafe (with his signature napkins) turns into a wonderful & intimate Jazz Club. We were in attendance on both days last weekend (September 2011) and enjoyed a terrific trio including a piano player and an "out of this world" female vocalist. The club has just the right ambiance and feel to cultivate a truly exceptional experience; on our two evenings, the crowd was interesting and friendly. If you aren't staying at the Hotel D'Aubusson, you certainly can drop by for a drink!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a Great Location with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: NYSojourner
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice boutique hotel in the St. Germaine / Left Bank area. It is totally central to all major tourist attractions yet also quiet in terms of traffic. The accomodations are solid 4 star quality including the beds and the bathrooms. The staff, particularly Royce at the front desk, was excellent and spoke english very well which made getting around really easy. Their suggestions were very helpful and they took the time to consider alternatives. The breakfasts were good and price for the room was fair. I had a lot of fedexing to do and the front desk could not have been more helpful. This is an excellent and well managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They've done it again!”
Reviews.Author: mflickermd
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd and 3rd time at the D'Aubusson Hotel . An our 2nd review. We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of our trip and 2 nights at the end.We were greeted warmly with almost all the same people as last time-a good sign.The first room was a good size-grand deluxe and the second, a junior suite. Both rooms were comfortable, clean and well maintained.We took the Romance Package and had a wonderful breakfast every day. We also took advantage of the Louvre tickets and heard a stunning concert at Sainte Chapelle. Their suggestions were right on target. The only "complaints" I could make is that the bathrooms are small.Secondly, the smoke from cigarette use in the outside courtyard made it unusable for us. Other than these minor problems, we would highly recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching. This is the place.”
Reviews.Author: Phillip E
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re looking for the perfect hotel, perfect location, unqualified service, and the charm of a romantic left bank, â€œrooftops of Parisâ€�, concierge hotel, you can stop looking. Hotel Dâ€™Aubusson is your place. This was our 40th anniversary, we had high expectations and they were exceeded. Thanks first go to Jill Jergel of Frontiers Travel who, for several months, politely but firmly kept routing us back to the Dâ€™Aubusson despite our early preference for someplace else. Although our stay was short (6 nights), we were overwhelmed by the patience, flexibility and responsiveness of the staff. Allow me to single out Laurent (sp), whose English was so good, I accused him of really being an English public school and Oxford grad. My first faux pas no doubt. But Laurent was just one of the many staff who were immediately there to answer questions, provide recommendations, solve problems and make sure your stay was memorable. Whether it was the wait staff in the breakfast room, the bartender, the doormen and baggage staff, room attendants, all went out of their way to specifically address your needs and make you feel welcome. I observed how they dealt with all the guests and not just us. We had a grande luxe room and took advantage of the â€œRomance Packageâ€�. The room was in the old section of the hotel with exposed wooden beam ceilings overlooking the courtyard (ask specifically for those rooms). Plenty big enough, very comfortable, nice sized bathrooms and a whirlpool tub to die for. The jets nearly ejected me out of the bath! Breakfast service was wonderful. So substantial you could almost skip lunch. I have to single out the rhubarb preserves -- a personal preference so please donâ€™t tell them I absconded with 3-4 little jars and brought them home in my carry ons.... As part of the Romance package, we had our choice of tickets to the Louvre or the Orangerie, a concert service in St. Chapelle (donâ€™t miss the Rose window), a private champagne lunch for 2, private airport pickup (boy was that crucial at 5 am on a flight 75 minutes early!), a bateaux (boat) excursion, and breakfast included. Iâ€™d also include VIP treatment per their prospectus but they treat all guests that way. Talk about scoring points with the boss. The jazz concerts in Cafe Laurent are amazing and donâ€™t forget to check out itâ€™s history. It could have been a part of the movie â€œMidnight in Parisâ€� with all the celebrities whoâ€™ve frequented the place. So, M. Spove: here are two recommendations for an increase in wages for Laurent and the rest of your staff. We will certainly be coming back once our bank account has been renewed and will highly recommend Hotel dâ€™ Aubusson to everyone we know. My only regret is that we could only stay 6 nights..........A bientot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers2011
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much indeed. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and it has a very relaxing atmosphere. The location is fantiastic and we enjoyed the many various eateries that are closeby. A cocktail in the courtyard is a must as is spending some time in the bar to outstanding sublime jazz!. It is a bit expensive and some longer stay specials would make it very attractive indeed. All in all though you won't regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at the heart of Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: Cr0cus
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this hotel. Coincidentally, each times we stayed in the same duplex room, which is quite comfortable in Parisian standards. The prices are high, but this is generally the case in this town. The hotel staff is very helpful, from the reservations to the check-out. The waiter in Cafe Laurent is probably one of the nicest waiters in Paris' hotel world. You have live jazz almost every night from 9 PM. Only downside that they can do nothing about is the noise. If your room is facing Rue Dauphine it stays very noisy and lively with quite heavy traffic night on and garbage trucks early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: michelecutty
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at your hotel and while it was very nice we found the price very expensive. We had a duplex room booked at early rate price of 440 euro per night we thought breakfast was included although on checking in we were told that it wasnt this we excepted as a misunderstanding. Although two lots of our friends had stayed just prior to us and had breakfast included On chatting to a lady staying there on our 3rd day she informed us that the price they were paying for their daughter and her family to stay in our room after we left was considerably cheaper. We certainly enjoyed the hotel but really at that rate I am sure it would have been more professional to offer breakfast even for half the stay as good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, again!”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferanne
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Hotel D'Aubusson was every but as good as our first, if not better. Brilliant location in the heart of St Germain de Pres, cafes , restaurants and shops all right there. 10 minutes walk to Luxembourg gardens. The room was beautiful, very good size, bathroom also a good size and very well equipped. Staff could not be more helpful - Went out of their way to make the isit very enjoyable Breakfast was delicious and afternoon drinks in the hotel courtyard was a perfect way to finish the day. This hotel is a perfect choice for this area, not cheap but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT LITTLE PARISIAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: nezzie
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel d'Aubusson and wished that we had more time in Paris. We had a lovely room - small (but this IS Paris) with a wonderful bathroom. The bathroom actually had a separate shower and a jacuzzi with a large window overlooking the little inside courtyard below. Staff was charming and helpful and location was absolutely fabulous. We didn't have breakfast there -- just coffee and a croissant which we purchased across the street and took over to the river in the morning. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PrimeTimeV
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff make you feel very welcome and are very helpful. Rooms are spacious for Paris and well outfitted. There were even some english tv channels. the only negative is that breakfast is expensive and becomes boring after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle915
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for eight nights and we felt that it was definitely the perfect choice. The hotel definitely offers the best location that has plenty of nice restaurants around, and is close to many sightseeing sites. Our room was beautifully decorated and relatively spacious considering the fact that it's in Paris! We also loved the breakfast and how it was until 11:30am. The receptionists were friendly and helpful. Our requests were responded efficiently. We had a wonderful stay with Hotel d' Aubusson, and will certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews here are absurd, terrible value.”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: I regret to say that the Dâ€™Aubusson was so disappointing my wife and I left after an hour. The room was 500 Euros, and it was a basic room (Jr Suite) with some extra square footage, low quality bedding and furniture, and AC that was insufficient. The bath had no separate shower, which is expected at 500 euro plus. The elevator had no air flow/fan and was insufferable. There was no phone in the room. Their parking elevator was acting up so if they parked your car they might not be able to get it out. No door man at arrival for luggage. This is bargain basement at its best. Just pathetic. This hotel is for bargain mongering Brits that want to stay on the left bank cheap and is not worth 200 euros. We went to the Hotel De Crillon, and were treated properly with a great room, some luxury, for a little more than Dâ€™Aubusson .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Lizcat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here from 4th - 8th August and as a special treat we chose this hotel for it's luxury having read great reviews. Don't get me wrong, we had a lovely stay. The room (306) was very spacious, with a huge bathroom and it was very quiet at night even with the windows partially open. The staff were all friendly and there was quite a large choice of breakfast items, with you being able to eat as much as you wanted and it was all very nice. As for the location, it's fantastic for arriving from the airport by train, easy to stroll to many of the major tourist sites and easily accessible to the metro for trips further afield or slightly away from the main Parisian centre. There are loads of restaurants and cafes in the near vicinity too. However, there are a few points that I would make and these are made because of the cost of a nightly stay - Â£285 for 2 people b&b at current exchange rates - and for no other reason. I did put these comments on a card at the end of our stay. We realise Paris is not a cheap city but have visited several times before, staying in cheaper hotels that have given better value for money. Sorry! The breakfast service - we found the clearing of tables very slow and as there are only a few tables, they have to be used several times during the long breakfast serving. The first morning, they ran out of cutlery and teapots and there was a comparatively small selection of bread and pastries. This may well have been due to the time we went down for breakfast but even so....The choice improved on other mornings and items were filled up quicker but the staff were still relatively slow at clearing tables and attending to people. They were nice enough staff but I almost felt like getting a tray and clearing some pots myself! My next 'issue' is with the standard of housekeeping in the room. It wasn't bad but the room was not hoovered until we requested it be done on the third day - we came back part way through the day and the bits on the floor from day 1 were still there. When we came back later, it had been done but I believe that it should be done daily in a hotel of this standard and price. I also note that previous reviewers have mentioned this lack of hoovering. Also, on the third day, we found one curtain had partially come down and hadn't been attended to when we came back. This was mentioned at the same time as the hoovering and rectified. We also found they left one small bottle of water for us on arrival but that was it. Again, I think that at this price, it should be standard to leave a bottle of water for each guest every day they are there. We could have used the ones in the minibar but I refuse to pay those prices! These may seem like picky things to mention but they make up part of the overall stay and I don't think should happen in a 4* quality hotel. So overall, a nice hotel to stay in, in a fabulous location but overpriced by 25% in our opinion. Â£200 a night would have been nearer the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Never come to paris and not stay here”
Reviews.Author: NLPP_11
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time that we have stayed at the D'aubusson. The first was in December 2008, then again for our honeymoon the following year, then the autumn of 2010 and now in May. The hotel has a wonderful cosy feeling in the winter and yet cool and airy in the warmer months. Each time the hotel has excelled itself in terms of standard of service and attention to detail. The location itself is perfect for us as St German is possibly our favourite district of Paris and from there everything is very walkable. The hotel is by no means cheap but for us, staying anywhere else now would be unthinkable. In particular the hotel bar and its manager deserve a mention for the excellent level of hospitality and friendliness. It is always nice to remembered.. Looking forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: MaryHogan
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The room are large and clean. The bathrooms are spotless and modern. The breakfast that is included with the room was very good - we really enjoyed the selection. The interior courtyard of the hotel was a great place to unwind with a glass of champagne after a day of touring. We brought my mother to Paris for her first-ever visit to the city of lights and this hotel made the trip a success from the beginning. We had easy access to everything and the hotel staff had excellent restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the right choice”
Reviews.Author: lattelite
Reviews.Content: I drove myself absolutely crazy trying to pick a hotel in Paris. So many to choose from, conflicting reviews and where to stay, right or left bank. This was my first time in Paris and I was traveling with my whole family (8). I finally decided on the left bank and the Hotel d'Aubusson. I was not disappointed. First of all I am so glad I chose the Left Bank as it was only a 5 minute walk from our hotel over the bridge to the right bank and many Paris attractions. When we returned back to the hotel at night we were surrounded by an entire neighborhood of restaurants, cafe's and bars. It is so beautiful to wander around the area. Everyone is sitting outside, music is playing. Wonderful area to be in and felt very safe. We were within walking distance to most of the main sightseeing sights. The Eiffel Tower was a good 45 minute walk but in going there you pass many other sights and it is a beautiful walk along the Seine. We did take a taxi there one night though as it was late. The are by the hotel is busy and if you leave your windows open at night it will be noisy but all the rooms have 2 sets of double panes on the doors and when closed you hear nothing. We enjoyed opening our windows during the day to hear everything below. The hotel staff are just A+. We arrived late at night and were greeted outside by several employees helping us to get to our rooms. Everyone who worked here was extremely polite and helpful. Thank god they all spoke english. The rooms are good size by Paris standards. Bathrooms are very nice. Our rate included breakfast which was awesome. Fresh squeezed juices, pastries, cereal, yogurts, fresh cut up fruit, eggs, bacon sausage, potatoes, veggies etc. Wonderful breakfast each morning. We also had a free boat ride on the Seine. The boats leave from Pont Neuf which is 5 minutes from the hotel. This was a wonderful cruise. We went early evening as it was cooler and less busy. The hotel provided us at a minimal charge, tickets to the Louve. We were able to walk right to the front to get in, this saved at least an hour or more in line. Thank god as it was very hot the day we went. Each morning we would stop at the front desk. Tell them where we were heading and they would draw on our maps the best routes, give us ideas for lunch, tips on the area etc. I really can't say enough about them. In the end I came down to 3 hotels to choose from. Relais Christine, Hotel Luxembourg Parc and d'Aubusson. We went to see the other 2 hotels as I was curious. Relais Christine is just around the corner. 30 seconds from d'Aubusson. This hotel is also beautiful. Gorgeous courtyard. The advantage to staying here is that it may be a little less busy as it is on a side street. We needed multiple rooms and the difference in price added up so that is why we didn't go here. Luxembourg Parc looked very nice but the location would not have been good for us. It is right by the Luxembourg gardens which are beautiful and worth a visit but it would take a good 15 minutes just to get to the Seine. The area also gets quite at night. After a long day sightseeing you don't want to have to walk back that far to your hotel. We loved d'Aubusson and would definitely return. There are also several other hotels on the same street and numerous within the area. some are cheaper but the area is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Alexanasta
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Travelled with two teenagers and rooms were big considering French standards. Location was walking distance to a very vibrant area! Staff very helpful, good breakfasts. You won't be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Cafe Laurent in the Hotel is a truely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Susan2dboots
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay in the hotel 2010, we have in past years, and it is very lovely. We chose their sister hotel so we can travel to our beloved Paris more frequently. The CafÃ© Laurent is a part of the Hotel. My review is for the CafÃ© Laurent. I have to disclose our dear fondness of Flavien who can kick his leg up to the sky, & Arnold with the most beautiful eyes. They are our adopted son's, without their consent in Paris for the past 12 + years. Jazz by Christian Brenner fills the place three times a week; he is a gifted and most talented and has guess talents as a wonderful surprise. We have enjoyed and appreciated Christian for more than 10+ years. I'm trying to write a helpful review; hopefully I have done so. Most Sincerely, Susan

Reviews.Title: “Nice Botique Hotel in a Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: roctraveler1
Reviews.Content: The room was in good shape for the age of the hotel. The bathrooms were updated. The lobby and sitting room are very nice. We stayed for three days over our10th wedding anniversary and got the VIP package. The manager left us a nice note upon arrival. We received a bottle of champagne the fist night and a bottle of wine our last night. Included in the VIP package was a river cruise on the Seine, a reservation for afternoon tea and breakfast every morning. Breakfast was delicious. The staff was friendly and very helpful the first two nights. There were different people on staff on the third day and they were not quite as friendly and helpful (on a comparative basis). The location could not be beat. We were within a short walk of most museums and tourist locations and the Metro was only two blocks away. The only thing that left a bit of a bad taste with me was that the hotel charged us a 20% premium over the actual cost of a 4 day Museum Pass when we purchased them at the front desk. They didn't tell us when we purchased them...and I didn't ask. It was only Euro 20 so it was not a big deal but it was my last dealing with the hotel as I noted the price upon check out. Overall, I think it was a very good experience and we would like stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Atmosphere In A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsForever1
Reviews.Content: We were highly impressed with Hotel D'Aubusson. I am comfortable with French, yet every staff member was also completely capable with English and more than happy to use it. Everyone staff member we encountered was helpful, greeted us with a smile and went the extra mile. The rooms are modern and comfortable. The buffet breakfast is very good and includes several hot items. The location could not be more ideal. Easy walking distance to many of the great monuments. Small hotel and cozy for those who prefer something smaller to the large hotels. Only downside was often even at 3pm the room had not been made. The hotel was so great we overlooked this one inconvenience

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, really good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: PuffleIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Knowing Paris quite well I also knew that this hotel was in quite a touristy area (St Michel/Odeon), but the road it's on is a quieter one than many around it and leads straight up to Pont Neuf. The hotel itself is small but really nice, with a lovely inner courtyard for drinks and/or breakfast. The standard rooms are ok but not overwhelming (really nice Hermes toiletries though). What did stand out though was the service - the people at reception went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and were extremely helpful with all our issues (most notably getting a restaurant that was just what we were looking for - relaxed atmosphere with a modern French cuisine - Christine round the corner from the hotel). Would come back here even though St Michel is not my favourite area in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected!”
Reviews.Author: deeloef
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted at Gare du Nord by the driver sent by Hotel d'Aubusson, we knew we had made the right choice of hotels. We were given room #507 which is a corner apartment on the top floor. It was roomy and comfortable for 3 adults: there was a king bed and a twin and still plenty of room to walk around, a table with 2 chairs, a desk and a wardrobe. The bathroom was spotless and had a shower and tub with plenty of fresh towels and Hermes toiletries! Because we were in a corner room, we had 3 windows that opened. The weather was cool for July so we enjoyed the cross-breeze. At night, there was noise from the street but as soon as we closed the window, we couldn't hear it at all. Because we had booked with a summer promotion, we had breakfast included every morning...it was a perfect start to the day and so convenient before heading out to explore Paris. And as for convenience, this hotel is just in the most perfect spot. Returning from a full day of wandering all over Paris, we could always find that special place for dinner within a block or two. Tons of cafes, brasseries, or a fresh gelato cone or fresh-made crepe were just steps away. When we ever get back to Paris, we'll stay right here at Hotel d'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Phenomenal service, Charming living areas”
Reviews.Author: Doby47
Reviews.Content: wow- where to start? LOCATION-- The location is perfect. I much prefer the 6th district (and it little boutiques, cafes, bistros and art galleries) to any others. The hotel is not deep in the 6th though- it is close to the river so you can walk to the Louvre, Notre dame and all the bridges and go the rightbank. On the south side of it you can wallk to St Germiane cafes, theaters etc. Yet it is up the block from the most charming intersetion in Paris- Buci intersection where 5 streets come togeher, north of Boulevard St Germaine. some of the streets are closed to traffic, others go to dead end little cobbletone roads with art galleries. SERVICE-- wow just wow. I have stayed there twice. It is a 4 star hotel wiht 5 star (or more) service. Staff is freindly,knowledgeable, bend over backwards. Ex- they upgraded our room which had a view of the court. They gave us a duplex street view, whcih cost 2x the price, at the same low price! Champagen in our room to greet us first night. The front desk confirmed all our restaurant reservations and gave us little notes. Friendly, warm and knowledgeable. Free computer use in comon rooms. No weird rules or restricitons (you could eat in the courtyard, or living room, sign anything to your room etc) COMMON AREAS- Great bar, open to the public wiht a piano and live jazz many nights. Huge but personal living room, with lots of sitting areas, huge brick wood-burinnig fireplace, wooden ceiling beams. Great place to have a drink after dinner. We made a point of hanging out every night before going to bed. 2 courtyards, 1 large and 1 small, where you could eat breakfast or hang out. ROOMs- average, clean and comfortable. Nice towels. All in all, 4 star price for 5 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: OrrvilleRedRider
Reviews.Content: My wife, 14 year old son and I spent three generally pleasant evenings in the Hotel Dâ€™Aubusson in June, 2011. I recommend the hotel. We had two rooms adjacent (but not adjoining) each other on the 3rd floor (floor #2, in European parlance). Our son had a â€œclassic roomâ€� and we had a â€œsuperiorâ€� room. Both rooms over looked the Rue Dauphine. Although the street is rather narrow and heavily trafficked during the day, two sets of double pane glass doors meant that street noise was never an issue. Both rooms had a small table with two comfortable chairs, as well as a desk with a chair. The beds were queen sized, and were comfortable. We had two windows (floor to ceiling double french doors each) and I was pleased with how bright the room was. Our sonâ€™s room, which but one window, was somewhat darker. The bathroom had one sink and tub/shower combo. Amenities were my favorite â€“ Hermes green orange. Linens and towels were of high quality. There was plenty of storage space in a wall of closets in the entry foyer in each room. Lighting in the room was good. During our stay the A/C worked well, although it never truly cooled the room beyond comfortable. Since the weather was mostly in the 70â€™s or lower while we were there, it made me wonder how the air conditioning would do in truly hot weather. That said, I had no reason to complain. Breakfast was decent by the standards of French hotels. There were the standard hot options â€“ eggs, potatoes, bacon and so forth. And the fruit and bread selections were plentiful. What made the hotel stand out, by my standard, was how effective and efficient the front desk staff were. As I worked to plan our visit to Paris, I asked for help with dinner reservations. I always amazed that no matter when I emailed the hotel with a question or a request, the staff always got back to me within 20 or 30 minutes. The staff was equally impressive when I posed questions in person. Bravo. The only quibble I had with the hotel related to noise from the CafÃ© Laurent, on the ground floor of the hotel. We were 2 floors above the CafÃ©. In the evenings, there is live music. It was plainly evident in our sonâ€™s room, and generally evident in our room in the evening. It kept our son up until the music stopped, somewhere around 12 midnight or thereafter. With the A/C fan set to â€œhighâ€� in our room, I didnâ€™t notice it as much, so it didnâ€™t affect sleep. That said, if you are a light sleeper and go to bed before 1 am, I would certainly request a room away from the CafÃ© Laurent side of the hotel. Iâ€™d come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ABHayes
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and loved the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, fantastic position, very comfortable beds and room and I particularly liked the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely home base in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: foleymomma
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights on her post graduation adventure! The location is perfect and the common areas of the hotel could not be more comfortable and inviting! The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive and did their best to meet all of our needs. I was a little disappointed when I had emailed the hotel in advance to make a lunch reservation at the Eiffel Tower for us ( the ONE thing I had prearranged before our visit) and despite receiving a confirmation from the hotel, when we arrived, for some reason, there was no record of the reservation! They were extremely apologetic, and I know stuff happens, but still... I was disappointed. Lesson learned - if you really have your heart set on something - do it yourself! The breakfast at the hotel more than made up for the lunch debacle! Delicious and abundant, featuring not only fresh pastries and fruit, but eggs, bacon, spinach and mushrooms ( my daughter is a vegetarian and enjoyed this alot). We also particularly enjoyed the little "extras" the staff had waiting in our room at the end of a long day of sightseeing - a small bottle of chilled wine, yummy macaroons, chocolates at turn-down (this traveler loves a good turn down service)! The room decor wasn't anything to get excited about, the bed was a bit lumpy and the linens nothing to write home about, but the bathroom was great and the robes, towels, and amenities all top-notch! The courtyard is a lovely peaceful spot to take a break and relax and the Wi-Fi throughout the hotel is an added bonus. All in all, Hotel d'Aubusson is a wonderful home base for your busy trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the staff!”
Reviews.Author: maccc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for for 3 nights. The location is perfect. It is walkable distance to the Louvre and to the Latin Quarter. Its around 50 steps from the river. First of all, i have to tell you about the staff. Some of the best i have seen. Any help you need, they ll get it done! The guys at the concierge desk helped me out a lot. From getting last minute tickets to Lido to getting us reservation at a fancy restaurent near the Eiffel Tower. Hands down, best hotel concierge service i ve seen The rooms and bathrooms are pretty small, but it is Paris after all. Rooms were clean and they gave us complimentary champange because we were on our honeymoon. Breakfast has a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoodbyeHeart
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the celebration of my partner's milestone birthday. Unfortunately, we had a different experience than most of the other reviewers. The public spaces are nice, but the room was not. The upholstery on the furniture was frayed and the room was never properly vacuumed. There was no street noise, but the live music on weekends made it impossible to sleep. The staff never acknowledged the birthday celebration even though this was noted in the reservation. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic luxury in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jwauters
Reviews.Content: To get the real Paris feeling, you must stay in this hotel! Great service, delicious breakfast and luxury rooms and bathroom with Hermes products. The hotel is perfectly located in the center, near Pont Neuf. We did almost everything by foot. We took the metro to Montmartre and Tour Eiffel and fell in love to the city of Paris... Saint-germain-dÃ¨s-PrÃ©s is a really nice neighbourhood where you have nice boutiques and distinguished bars and restaurants. Looking for luxury in a romantic setting in Paris? This is where you'll want to stay ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Small Chic and Charming!”
Reviews.Author: lisaleslie
Reviews.Content: Loved this property! Everything was nice. Loved the courtyard, the library, the lounge with live jazz and just the vibe of this hotel. Flavien, Chef Barmen, was just a welcoming lovely person. Rooms were nice, clean and provided you with Hermes toiletries. The bathrooms were small but new. Extremely quiet with the windows closed. This is located in the Left Bank and was the perfect location for sightseeing. The best part of our day was getting back to the quiet of the hotel and recapping our day sitting in the courtyard. There are restaurants galore. This is a chic boutique hotel that I highly recommend. There are some junior suites with beamed ceilings that are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, full of character, and in a great location. GO HERE.”
Reviews.Author: MarshieJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel d'Aubusson for three nights, after being recommended by a friend. It was truly outstanding. The room, a superior suite, was clean, beautifully appointed, and was the perfect Paris hotel. The room itself was reasonably small, but large by Paris standards, the bathroom was huge, full of natural light, and had a great bath. The central courtyard downstairs was fantastic, and the barman remembered our names and drinks every night. The whole hotel feels intimate and very French. The location cannot be beat. While expensive, if you can afford it, I cannot reccomed this hotel highly enough, and I am fussy. Even though we were not at the end of our holiday, I had pangs to leave. I will definitely be back, and will also tell all my friends to go. really, really fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Roz127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first part of our honeymoon in Paris, at Hotel d'Aubusson. The location can't be beat. Fun, upbeat neighborhood with practically everything walking distance, including the train station that took us to Versailles. The hotel staff was very courteous. Our room (the Grand Lux) was smaller than expected but quite lovely and very comfortable. It was romatically appointed with a very nice marble bathroom. The courtyard was absolutely adorable and relaxing to sit at in the evenings. The breakfasts were excellent, and included hot food (eggs, bacon, sausage, etc), which is unusual in France. The only negative was the weak wifi signal.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but you can find better”
Reviews.Author: KristinO
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an ok stay here for 3 nights. Our room on the 5th floor was oddly configured. There was a loft space over the entry area which is accessed by a spiral staircase. While this seems quaint at first, it's actually pretty useless, and the stairs take up a lot of space, and the room is otherwise quite small. We had very little space for our suitcases, and there weren't any luggage stands, so the bags were just left on the floor. The bathroom was nice, but small. Bed was hard. Didn't really go for the faux wood wall paper. Don't thing the carpet was ever vacuumed while we were there. Breakfast was ok, but not worth the price. Staff was very friendly, and the location is great, but for the price of this hotel, you can find much better options in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “No Place better”
Reviews.Author: CasperBurger
Reviews.Content: This will be our 3rd time back to the Hotel d'Aubusson coming up in August. We can't wait to return. All of our clients & friends who stay here say it is just grand. Small, Boutique, great location, excellent staff, amenities - love the Hermes soaps, etc. Just a perfect place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel With a Great Loacation In Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kaytan85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first to Paris and this hotel was recommended to us. What a perfect choice. The location could not have been any better. We were a block from the river, with cafes, and shops right around the corner. We walked to everything from the hotel. We could have not been more pleased with our experience. We booked the Romance Package and would highly recommend this if available. We loved the breakfast every morning, the river cruise, church concert, Orsay museum, airport limo pickup and champagne lunch which was all included in this package. We upgraded to a Grand Luxe room that was very nicely appointed with fine soaps and lotions and a very comfortable bed. The customer service provided by all was absolutely first class from our initial pickup by our limo driver, to Jean at the front desk and Flavin at the bar. Everyone was so accommodating our entire trip. Special thanks to all of you for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Paris hotel situated in the Latin Quarter offering a comfortable, warm and friendly environment.”
Reviews.Author: Simontoller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel D'Aubusson in January 2011 and found it welcoming and friendly. All the staff made our stay most enjoyable. We travelled with our young son (5 years old) who felt completely at home. We stayed in a junior suite and found it both clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was exceptional and the bar proved to be a popular and friendly place to hang out in the evening. The hotel is situated in the Latin Quarter and is ideal for excursions around Paris being very close to Notre Dame, the Seine, the Lourvre and the Jardin du Luxembourg. There is a huge variety of restaurants and cafes in the area as well as many interesting shops and markets around the Blvd St Germain. If you are looking to stay in a traditional medium sized Paris hotel offering a warm and friendly ambience, I would firmly recommend the Hotel D'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “Every time I go back to Paris I will be staying at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christine12363
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need and if not, the very friendly and efficient staff will get it for you. The hotel is small, beautiful and with a great location. They serve a fantastic breakfast and has a cool bar with live music. We had the most amazing stay in Paris at this hotel. Very polite and friendly staff with every encounter. Good size room with all comforts catered for. Would definitely recommend and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff: Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Oak_Arbour
Reviews.Content: Arrival at d"Aubusson set the tone; automatic doors and a bellman who appeared immediately to help with the bags! Lovely room with lots of French charm! Free high-speed Internet - always a big thing! The hotel is located just a short walk south of Pont de Neuf, ten minutes to the Louvre, Notre Dame. Great restaurants nearby: Le Christine (just around the corner on Rue Christine) served the best Creme Brule we've ever had; and the Rose de France on Place Dauphine (just off the Pont Neuf bridge) was a post-card sidewalk cafe for savoring French wine and cheese. The staff were always present and very responsive. You won't be disappointed! We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 3510House
Reviews.Content: I recently took my 10 year old daughter to Paris for the first time. I found the Hotel d'Aubusson, with it's excellent location in St-Germain, wonderfully warm and welcoming. Our room was spacious and the bathroom huge by Paris standards. Lovely Hermes bath products were a treat. What really sets this hotel apart is the staff. Everyone from the concierge to our breakfast waiter was wonderful. A perfect home base for our time in Paris! From my daughter, a fan of the late-night snack: "They have the best club sandwiches in the world."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for St. Germaine Area”
Reviews.Author: BCJ_8
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Paris with friends and we stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson. We had not stayed there previously and we were delighted with the hotel. It is located between some of the busiest parts of the St. Germaine neighborhood and the Pont de Neuf, with quick access to the right bank and most of central Paris. The rooms are large by Paris standards, clean and bright. The only minor complaint is that the bed covers were worn and frayed but otherwise everything looked fresh. The wi-fi internet was free and strong but required frequently logging on time and time again which was a little aggravating. The staff was particularly helpful and pleasant in making travel arrangements and dinner reservations. Other than the breakfast we did not eat at the hotel restaurant and it looked pretty dead in the evening but plenty of great restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cheapest but one of the best”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenGlobe
Reviews.Content: We took the "Winter promotion" which is a great offer compared to standard prices. With its perfect location you can choose between small bistros and Michelin starred restaurants within walking distance. A charming hotel with a very helpfull staff. Next time in Paris we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaM63
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The location is excellent and it is truly a "French" experience. The rooms are spacious and very clean and we loved the courtyard as well as the nightly piano playing downstairs. The staff were extremely friendly and so helpful. When we return to Paris, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/great staff!”
Reviews.Author: aralston
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris a few times and this experience was the best yet. The location was awesome- I would only stay in this area from now on. There are so many restaurants and boutiques around and you can walk to all of the museums. It's perfect! The staff was also very accomodating. The concierge got us some great restaurant reservations and after a small hiccup with the a/c in our first room, they immediately upgraded us to a junior suite without us asking. That is the type of customer service you want and makes a hotel better than the others. Thank you for a great five days!

Reviews.Title: “Smiling, English speaking, Dining reservations always secured,LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kcfood
Reviews.Content: In the past 31/2 years I have made 9 trips to Paris and my choice of hotel has been the d'Aubusson. Not only is one greeted warmly upon arrival, but my favorite flowers are in my room and notes from the concierge confirming my dinner reservations. The location is superb with many of the most visited sites in Paris within walking distance-the middle of the Pont Neuf is steps away for viewing of the Eiffel tower lighting "on the hour". There are many delightful and fun bars, cafes, bistros, and restaurants in the area and great shopping for antiques and clothing. The new bathrooms are fabulous!!!!! and the sheets are crispy and sleep is the best. The staff is amazing and go out of their way to take care of every wish-thank you to Jean, Audrey,Laurent, Alexandra, Enzo, Vi...they are all great. Cafe Laurent and the courtyard for a cocktail or glass of champagne with Flavien and Arnaud is a great way to start the evening, especially on jazz nights.Can't imagine staying anywhere else. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel, with attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: phildibbsy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for her birthday. We have travelled to Paris many times, and we really love this part of town for it's bars, galleries, and atmosphere. We stayed in an attic suite on the 5th floor. The suite was really just a large room, but it was very large, and was very atmospheric. The location of the hotel is excellent, and we loved the bar, and general ambience, but what really sold it to us was the attentiveness of the staff.
