Room service was some of the most efficient and speedy I have ever had, and without exception the staff were polite and helpful - sadly not always the case in Paris! One small issue was the strength of the WiFi signal which was weak. Overall a lovely weekend. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in SGdeP/ 6eme Arond.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: popartpooch
Reviews.Content: My extended family of 9 (ages 9-79) stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson over Spring Break and we were all throughly impressed. It is a little jewel box of a hotel with all the bells and whistles of a 5 star property. The public areas are incredibly lush and beautifully decorated. The staff is extremely accomodating. The rooms aren't huge but they are great for Paris standards. The beds are wonderful. The bathroom was a granite with Hermes bath products!! Every day we were met with a treat like a box of macaroons, a bottle of wine, an invitation to take tea in the living room. We felt like kings. The location was within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, etc. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great and Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: bouilly
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel d' Aubusson was one of the most memorable experiences of our life (seven decades long). The warm caring staff along with their wonderful service made us feel comfortable and safe. The whole experience was truly outstanding. We will remember this visit for the rest of our lives. Thank you Enzo, Jean, Laurent, Luxman, Roshan, Sarah, Vi and the rest of the staff of D'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovestravelagents2
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time and were so impressed by the staff and the location. We could walk to fabulous restaurants, and cafes. The Seine is just a stroll away, - Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay all within an easy walk. Hotel d'Aubusson has everything that a comfortable top hotel needs. While we were there, there was even an evening of live opera (four or five wonderful singers) in their small cozy bar. We enjoyed it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel d'Aubusson”
Reviews.Author: righteousbabe73
Reviews.Content: This authentic Parisian hotel is fabulous. The hotel is very charming and has a lovely sitting area with a real, woodburning fireplace that was burning every afternoon. We stayed in a grand luxe room which was very large with a huge, comfortable bed. The room also had a table and sitting chair, DVD player and a wonderful bathroom with a spa bath. There is free WiFi, but if you have more than one computer make sure you obtain two separate sets of logons/passwords. We stayed in a 17th century style room with a canopy bed and exposed wooden beams. The room was very spacious and there were several English language TV channels, including BBC and a Russian news channel in English. The hotel also provides free DVD rentals, although the choices are somewhat limited. The hotel is in a wonderful location and many museums and other tourist sites are within easy walking distance. The Seine River is very close and there are a wide-variety of cafes, pizza shops and other dining options at your doorstep. There is a great pub right across the street named "The Hideout" if you want to grab a low-key, inexpensive drink at the end of the day. From the moment we arrived, the concierge staff was extremely attentive, pleasant and always willing to help and accomodate our needs. There is a nice bar area but I rarely saw any patrons there during our Sunday - Wednesday stay. I am sure the bar draws a crowd when there is live music. I highly recommend booking one of the packages on the website. You will pay a lot of money to stay here regardless, but the packages offer many addiitonal perks such as museum tickets, a Seine River cruise, airport pick-up and daily breakfast. Overall, this is an excellent, high-end hotel with a great staff. I highly recommend it and would stay here again. My only complaint is the street noise which was loud and easily heard from our room, even in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “I used to love, love, love this hotel..but it's fading.”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here since 2002 for both pleasure and work. I love the location and the charming bar downstairs (cafe Laurent) - hello Flavian! I was excited to revisit a few weeks ago and came away very disappointed. The rooms are really fading. Chips on wood, ripped bedskirt and it looks like there were at least 7 different wood finishes on the various pieces in the room. The rooms are still good sized and the bathrooms are nice (tub/shower combos and hermes toiletries if you care) but the rooms are definitely on the down swing. And the prices haven't changed! Still one of the more expensive places in the neighborhood to stay and the breakfast at 25 euros a head is still ridiculously ovepriced. The Hotel Buci is reopening soon (probably even a slightly better location) - I bet they'll give the d'Aubusson a real run...

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, good value, fantastic jazz on Saturday night!”
Reviews.Author: GastrofanLondon
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel in a great St Germain location. Concierge very helpful and friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed the jazz evening - we caught an hour of it after Saturday dinner. Very good cocktails from the bar. Very nice, spacious, clean room. Hermes toiletries! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED HOTEL D'AUBUSSON!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travelCt
Reviews.Content: My huband, our two daughters (ages 12 and 10) and I stayed here last July. We stayed in a junior suite with a connecting deluxe room for our daughters. It was absolutely perfect. First, I thought that only the junior suites had the lovely wooden beamed ceilings, but our daughters' connecting deluxe room had the same lovely ceilings as our room did. We were on the third floor. I wish we were there right now! The staff were so friendly and welcoming. The rooms were beautiful. The location of the hotel is ideal. My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon at Le Meurice in Paris, which was lovely, but at half of the price, Hotel D'Aubusson was perhaps even lovelier. It was intimate and it was a wonderful place to return to after sight seeing. The public spaces are fantastic. There were free movies at the reception desk that we could take upstairs for our girls to watch if they got tired. We would happily return here tomorrow if time permitted!!!!! We have already sent other friends there who love it as well, and are already returning this April. Lucky them.

Reviews.Title: “Great left bank location; superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: scbelle
Reviews.Content: So... first tip: book directly through the hotel. My mother has an irrational fear of exchange rate fluctuations, so she insisted on booking through an unfamiliar website that allowed payment in advance in dollars. Luckily (#1) I called to confirm with the hotel the day before we left--that booking company had gone belly up and hadn't paid the D'Aubusson. Hard to explain the depth of my gratitude that the hotel had kept our reservation--though they had been assured that the website had contacted all of their customers, the hotel didn't trust them. Not only did they save our reservation, but they also offered us a package with MORE amenities at a slightly lower price. GOLD STAR! We were booked for a superior room, and I think this would be the one thing I would change about the stay. While the room was huge by European standards, the decor was quite drab. It wasn't the end of the world because when forced to stay inside, we used the public rooms of the hotel. The bed was ok-comfy. The bathroom was small but luxurious--WONDERFUL tub and one of the best showers I've ever had in a hotel. LOVED the Hermes toiletries. The breakfast room was lovely, and the buffet breakfast provided hot and cold items. It was perfect for a travelling breakfast, though get their early if you are very hungry! The jazz bar was a delight--there are a few regulars around but all were very friendly. The parlor is a joy as well... We were forced inside one afternoon when my mother was unwell and it was pouring down rain, but it was quite nice to sit by the fire and read or chat with other guests. The fire was lovely, but a bit comical--the fireplace is huge but they build the tiniest fire! And are quite stingy with the wood. Very funny. All in all, a great location and quite the bang for your buck. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A return trip does not disappoint....”
Reviews.Author: EastHamptonGinger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the d'Aubusson in December to celebrate his birthday and we were so glad we came back to this hotel. The wonderful staff and lovely, intimate interiors make us feel that we have our own apartment in Paris, without all the expense and worry. We hope to be back many times. It is, truly, the perfect Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A charming gem”
Reviews.Author: greymans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a long weekend in October. Great hotel with a generally excellent staff. Beautiful rooms, charm and great location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Left Bank Luxury”
Reviews.Author: mwbush80
Reviews.Content: We capped off our trip to Europe in Paris. Hotel d'Aubusson is a great luxury hotel on the fun side of the city. The hotel is within a two minute walk to the Seine and is close to very many excellent restaurants, bistros, shopping, and metro stations. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as we were out touring the city most of the time, but this was a great home base in Paris. Our room was large and luxurious and had a very nice bathroom. Hotel d'Aubusson will be our first choice when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Does not come any better”
Reviews.Author: Alstromeria33
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the hotel, and I realise I have not left a review yet. We are parisian ... and enjoy a night away from home in a dream place now and then. In the summer we go outside the city for greenery and a swimming pool, in the winter and especially when the weather is rough, we like to "travel in the city" , minimal requirement being beautiful with a fireplace. The d'Aubusson is absolutely perfect for us, and I can imagine even more 'of a trip' for foreigners. Clean, quiet, perfect service, great staff. Not far from home for us it is a travel in time in a 17th century building, where everything feels authentic yet perfectly brought up to modern comfort. We love the 'salon', warm and comfy, for a drink by the fireplace before going out for diner, and again upon return for liquor or tea. Or the terrasse when the weather allows. We enjoy Live Jazz at Cafe Laurent , the hotel bar, visited by many Parisan. The rooms are rather large with very high ceilings , nicely decorated (prefer the back building with wooden ceilings). The bathroom is impeccable, decorated with perfect taste (Hermes amenities). Bathrobes and slippers provided. I feared it might be a bit cold - not easy to warm up such a building with high ceilings in the heart of winter, it was perfectly heated; while we watched snow falling through the double-window ; we slept better than we had in weeks ; unwinding from a tough year end. It is perfectly located for a stroll, in the heart of St Germain. Management is also up to the standards. We have had a mishap once and were very elegantly offered compensation. Our short stay ends with breakfast where nothing misses. Quality and variety. We always leave with regrets... I highly recommend this hotel, to foreigners visiting our city or to Parisans who want to treat thmeselves with luxury and romance. We will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in fantastic location - will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Carne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel d'Aubusson for 7 days and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable. We stayed in a 2 room suite with a mezzanine floor and it was beautiful. The decor in the lounge and breakfast room was stunning and the hotel bar was fun, with live music 3 nights a week. The location of the hotel is fantastic with many restaurants nearby and a short walk to the metro and several of Paris' attractions. I will definitely stay there next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further”
Reviews.Author: starynight
Reviews.Content: This is simply the best boutique hotel in Paris! I have been a client for many years now and have never been disappointed. The accommodations are lovely, public spaces very inviting, the staff could not be more friendly and helpful, the breakfast offerings are numerous and excellent, the hotel location is wonderful - within easy walking distance of St Germain, 4 mÃ©tro stops, numerous restaurants, a 15 minute walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Ile St-Louis, and lots of shopping - something for everyone. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: mss2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel D'Aubusson for five days during the first week of October 2010. The service from arrival thru departure was warm, professional and welcoming. We stayed in a fifth floor room that was quiet and certainly large enough for two adults. Almost every night some surprise awaited us, champagne, fruit, chocolates, just a very nice touch. The concierge staff was spectacular, a special thank you to Audrey. They were able to suggest and arrange daytime activities with the req'd tickets to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, river boats and wals around the St Germain area. Having never been to Paris the help provided by the staff at the hotel made all the difference in the trip. The restaurants that were reccomended by the hotel were unique and fit just what my wifr and I were looking for. Everything from "country or home style french food to more sophisticated high end cuisine. The St Germain area was great for first time visitors. Almost everything was within walking distance, lots of cafes, restaurants and bistros in the immediate area. Can not say enough good things about this hotel or our stay there. Certainly would return only wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely top notch. Ticked every box!”
Reviews.Author: Natstar26
Reviews.Content: I had a truly wonderful stay at this hotel. I was traveling on business with a few days to explore Paris on my first trip to the city and the hotel staff made it feel like a home away from home. The hotel is beautiful. I stayed in a superior room which was a quite large for Paris standards with a beautifully renovated bathroom (apparently they have all been) with Hermes bathroom products. The room was lovely and the bed very comfortable. Not a great selection of TV channels, but hey, you are in Paris and shouldn't be watching television anyway! The staff were brilliant. They all remembered my name, room number and were more than happy to let me practice my French on them. They made terrific recommendations for restaurants and things for me to do in the evening. I departed the hotel at 4.30am in the morning and even then the staff were happy and more than helpful. The hotel courtyard is a lovely place to sit and wind down with a glass of wine, and the complimentary cheese crackers and little sandwiches you receive with your drink were very yummy! Wifi access was great everywhere throughout the hotel. I had breakfast at the hotel one morning during my stay but with so many awesome cafes in the area it is better to head out for breakfast. The location is fabulous. The immediate area and Boulevard St Germain de Pres has some fabulous shopping, with some of the usual large shops and some smaller shops with unique products and clothing. The hotel is a short walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, St Chapelle etc. I absolutely agonized over where to stay for my first trip to Paris and couldn't have been happier with the hotel, the service, the staff, the location. There was nothing more I could have wished for. Other than to have my family with me. Now that would have made it truly perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to a Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Maren26
Reviews.Content: My new husband planned a surprise three week honeymoon for the two us of, and the Hotel d'Aubusson was the last stop, and the best hotel we experienced. We told them it was our honeymoon, and received an amazing upgrade to one of their oldest rooms, 211. Exquisite! They even brought us complimentary champagne to our room. How can you beat Hermes bath products and the location? The concierge was incredibly helpful as well. We skipped the breakfast our first day, and regretted it. At 25 euros, it's quite a value and delicious. The atmosphere was perfect for a Parisian getaway: roaring fire in the sitting room, exposed, 17th century beams throughout, and gracious hospitality all made for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea29902
Reviews.Content: Just returned from France and had a wonderful stay at the Hotel d'Aubusson. The hotel is located close to the Lourve, Notre Dame and walking distance to many of the musuems. The staff could not have been more helpful and gracious. Our room was a little small, but very clean. There are many very good resturants in the neighborhood. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: jsavadier
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel D'Aubbusson on many occassions. Each stay is better than the next! The staff is efficient, welcoming and warm, the rooms are comfortable, and the location is superb! We would not stay anywhere else in Paris! Janet, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jacers1
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers could not have said it better about this hotel. Location is perfect. The service, rooms, etc was perfect. To end a perfect day/evening in Paris is the hotel bar, Cafe Laurent, which has live jazz Wed-Sat. nights. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful hotel with exceptional friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: zeggy
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located hotel within walking distance of most Parisian sights. The most helpful, friendly concierges . The romance package is truly wonderful. The champagne lunch in the courtyard, and the violin concert which were part of the package were highlights of our trip.Would love to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch, first class hotel with first class service.”
Reviews.Author: jtrn
Reviews.Content: In addition, it is ideally located in the 6th district, two blocks from the Pont Neuf, making it a wonderful place to stay in Paris! You can easily walk to places like the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, St. Michel, Notre-Dame, etc. The area has some wonderful cafes and restaurants nearby, including Jacques Cagna. Above all, from the time one enters the hotel to the time one checks out, one can expect to be treated with such elegant and warm service from the entire staff, especially Audrey and Jean. This is truly an exceptional hotel that delivers an exceptional experience! Our room was especially spacious and elegantly appointed, overlooking a small, private courtyard. Looking forward to returning to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful French hotel experience--planning to return”
Reviews.Author: MissyinVermont
Reviews.Content: Location two blocks across Pont Neuf, around the corner from St Michel metro, and so close to so much recommend the hotel alone. Add to that the following: a really great atmosphere, a lovely courtyard for coffee in the morning and drinks in the afternoon/evening; very nicely appointed sleeping rooms, breakfast spaces, and sitting areas. Here's the wonderful thing: I was looking for an electrical outlet late one evening and the man who had helped with luggage three days earlier and was zipping across the lobby area, actually detoured and spent the time to assist me. The helpfulness of most all the staff are the reason I already look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique Hotel--With $35 Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ThommmFlorida
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Boutique Hotel. Very clean. Friendly, competent service. Rooms considerably larger than most small Paris hotels. Nice lobby and hotel bar. Great location one block from Seine, at the Pont Neuf. Good cafes and restaurants nearby on Rue de Buci. Beware the hotel breakfast at 25 Euro each, which is not included in the hotel rate--we thought it was, and it usually is in small French hotels. If we had bothered to check this, we would have had our croissant and coffee at a nearby cafe for much less than this. The breakfast assortment is very nice however, and even includes powdered eggs, French bacon, and sausage links if these things ring your chimes! I would stay here again, but it is VERY expensive compared to other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Truly charming, helpful, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnandphilip
Reviews.Content: My husband loved our week stay at the Hotel d'Aubusson. The hotel is quite lovely, with a beautiful outside courtyard and sitting room. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, with everything from restaurant reservations to bringing up to our room free crackers and olives when we requested wine glasses one evening. Our 'summer package' was a terrific value -- included was the breakfast (regularly something like 20 Euros), tickets to the Louvre, a tea/pastry service for two, and a Seine boat ride. They also brought up a lovely half bottle of Champagne to our room the first night, and pastries for most nights after. Location was great, too. Walked just about everywhere. Would highly recommend this hotel, and we'll definitely be staying at the Hotel d'Aubusson when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnASeattle
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip back to the Hotel dâ€™Aubusson and will return again. The rooms are large and bathrooms are undergoing remodeling (our room had the change and it was very nice). The location is perfect being a couple of blocks from the Seine and the heart of the left bank. Breakfast is one of the best that we have had in our travels in Europe. Full European Breakfast along with eggs cooked to order if you request. The pastries and meat were wonderful along with scrambled eggs with bacon, ham, etc. The staff are always available to assist you in your daily travels and making reservations at local restaurants or three star properties. Always a smile and â€œbonjourâ€� when you come and go. The bar on the first floor has jazz several nights a week and it is a special time in Paris to sit there and enjoy the music. We had the romance package and it is well worth looking into if you stay at the hotel for more than three nights. A wonderful experience and more than reason enough to return to Paris. That we will do!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: bdelsavio
Reviews.Content: This hotel in a fabulous location: close enough to main attractions, but on a fairly quiet yet vibrant street near the Latin Quarter. We were able to walk almost anywhere and especially enjoyed wandering the charming neighborhood at night. The rooms were small, but clean. What set this hotel apart from others for me was the staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful and had a big smile on his or her face. I must admit I was a little worried about the reported disdain the French have for Americans. But these folks couldn't have been nicer. We paid 1/2 of what we could have for some of the "big name" hotels in Paris. Hopefully one day we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not special enough either”
Reviews.Author: fstminlv
Reviews.Content: Really great central location. Vibrant St. Germain-des-Pres a few blocks south, Latin Quarter a few blocks to the east. Notre Dame, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, all easy walking distance. Ze Kitchen Galerie two blocks away was fabulous Asian-French fusion. Highly recommend as it tied with Guy Savoy for less dough. (Side note: Taillevent was a disappointment.) Back to the hotel itself: nice enough in overall feel but closer to what I'd consider a 3 star, not 4. Standard room was decent but pretty basic and bland in decor. Not noisy at all, although we overlooked Rue Dauphine. Breakfast was included for us but same thing everyday for a week got old. Front desk staff mixed bag: one girl gave me wrong metro train directions, one young man was sweet and tried hard but not super knowledgeable, one guy (early 30's?) offered valuable info re Versailles being closed on Mondays when he overheard me talking to the other guy about going there the next day, which allowed us to go on Sunday instead and saved us the aggravation of going all the way out there only to be disappointed/frustrated. No water one day when I wanted to shower at noon. I left the taps on and got water 10 mins. later. When inquired later, was told it was out for 45 minutes while being worked on. I realize it was an off time of day to shower, but if I'd been in a hurry, that would have been incredibly frustrating. Also, the water temp was preset to 38 degrees and was not hot enough and had weak pressure, while water from the hand-held head was nice and hot and strong pressure. A bit of a pain to have to use both in order to have a proper shower. Lastly, drain plug didn't work and the maid just pulled it out and left it on the sink after the first day when she saw that the tub wasn't draining. Weirdly enough, though the sheets didn't feel rough to the touch, they made loud paper-rustling sounds when moving around during night. No problem for the asleep one; slightly irritating for the one TRYING to fall asleep. Nice touch was that each day we got something different gratis: 1/2 bottle champagne, flowers, macaroons, fruit basket, jar of poached pears. And the usual chocolate covered almonds each night. Hope this info is helpful, as I tried to provide different information than the standard reviews......

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: ã�Œã‚†ã�“
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Paris and the hotel staff are very very nice. The room we got was facing street and was not the most calm room (but we booked last minute and it was Friday night - so I recommend telling to give them a room that is not facing street when booking if you are booking in advance). Still the room was comfortable and we had a very good stay. For some reason there is no restaurant where you can have dinner but there is a in-room dining service available, which offers really good food. I will probably come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Like being with Family”
Reviews.Author: reloga
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris at the Hotel d'Aubbuson. The location was great--only a few blocks from the Seine in St. Germain district. The hotel staff were warm and inviting. We were treated like family. Before we left the states everyone warned us that the French would be unfriendly. We found just the opposite. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. simply treat people as you would like to be treated. If you are looking for a nice hotel in a good location this it it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ika27
Reviews.Content: I will always remember this hotel and most definitely will stay in this hotel. We booked hotel through Travel Agency here in US, however apparently our room was very small to fit a 8 years old kid which was very stressful to find out after 8 hrs flight. Hotel staff( don't remember his name) was extremely helpful and were able to upgrade our room to the junior suite. Excellent room and excellent service. Next time we are in Paris- we will stay in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Twenty Fifth Anniversary at the Hotel D'Aubusson”
Reviews.Author: JuanBerbatov
Reviews.Content: I recently suprised my wife with a trip to Paris in March to celebrate our twenty fifth wedding anniversary and had chosen the Hotel D'Aubusson. Having booked the hotel in August of last year Jean and his conceriege staff stayed in contact answering all the questions about restaurants etc, including recommending the outstanding Taillevent. The Hotel, its staff, location, rooms, breakfast, are, as other have pointed out, excellent. If you are interested in staying on the left bank, within easy walking distance of everything from the Deux-Magots to Notre Dame you should seriously consider this hotel. Pick an olderstyle room with the exposed beams and dont worry about a little music on a Friday or Saturday night Thank you Jean and Audrey - you helped make our visit very special

Reviews.Title: “If you want the best in location, value, quality, and above all,staff, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: mflickermd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our France trip. Our welcome was smooth and genuine. The room was well equipped,although it looked like the bathroom needed some remodelling. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet.j Breakfast was good and the location was superb. We also enjoyed the perks that came with our package-tickets to the Louvre, a boat ride on the Seine, tickets to a Vivaldi concert at SAint Chapelle. The most ourstanding quality of this excellent hotel was the quality of the staff. They remembered our names,always greeted us, made some wonderful recommendations for restaurants, and were, in general, very responsive to our needs.They also responded immediately to our critique of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bearsbigfan
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at this hotel. Great location, walk to Latin Quarter Cafes, Notre Dame etc. Loved the ambiance and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in the left bank”
Reviews.Author: Bordeaux&castles
Reviews.Content: This lovely, elegant little boutique hotel in the 6th of Paris is just a wonderful place! The staff went beyond expectations in providing us a very special room with the 17th century beamed ceilings, canopy, special welcome and congratulations for our recent engagement and my birthday...simply perfect. In fact they even arrranged a special concert performance for us at St. Chapelle cathedral for our last night and was the perfect ending to the perfect trip! I am extremely particular when I travel - I want the best. This little gem in a charming section of Paris fit the bill for our last hotel stay during our three week holiday in France. Sometimes you don't want the big "city" feel in a hotel with lots of crowds,big lobby and buzz. This hotel has a luxurious feel without the tension or pretension. The hotel has a nice feel to it, understated elegance and just the right location - - close to everywhere you want to be. I loved it. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: RIlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this hotel is! A great mix of French and modern convenience. Located in the Latin quarter, a quick walk to either the Pont Neuf, Saint-Michel or Odeon metro stations and right near blvd St. Germain. 10 minute walks to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Our room was on the 1st floor (one up from the main level) and was very big for European standards. King bed, two chairs and table, very big/modern bath, flat tv. Nightly turn down service with chocolates & slippers. Staff spoke English. Lovely breakfast room with daily hot/cold buffet breakfast. Outdoor terrace w/ heaters so we could sit outside with cocktails and still hear the live jazz from Cafe Laurent - the hotel bar that has jazz musicians most nights. Lots of charm and little touches - fresh flowers in the room, bottle of champagne on our 1st night, a small gift in our rooms on New Year's Eve, and champagne offered at breakfast on New Year's day. I can't say enough about this hotel and would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location...lovely hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: passioninlife
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our choice to stay at Hotel d' Aubusson for Christmas. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. They accommodated us in every way possible to assure that we had a great holiday. The Salon was decorated beautifully and a fire was burning all day and night. It was an extra delight to hear the music from Cafe Laurent as it was part of the hotel. Our room was a duplex for four...I would say that as lovely as the room was, I would rent two rooms next time as we were traveling with older teenagers. The sound travels in the loft style duplex. The breakfasts were delicious and well appointed with a wide variety of foods. I would highly recommend this hotel for its wonderful atmosphere, convenient location and friendly helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: lukejohnson
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel and if not for the french staff's lack of patience with other customers I would say the service was great that's two big australian thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Good,but just so.”
Reviews.Author: sheams54
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in dozens of hotels in the 6th in the last 20 years and this one is solid,no question, but perhaps not all that you might expect. The location is very good,the service,superbe, but the rooms.......let's say they are comfortable (though the faux wood wallpaper will remind you of your basement rec. room as a teen)....but not overly so and I promise you,you'll forget them the moment you're out the door. The salon with the great fireplace is very,very nice, but there are sooooooo many americans about that it is difficult to imagine that you are anywhere but a left bank hotel that Rick Steves has deemed "high end cool" with "larger than average rooms". I will say that their windows are TRULY sound proof and so you'll have none of the late-night-revelers annoyance that plague the "Le Regence" and "Le Dauphine" just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take a room overlooking Rue Dauphine- too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcCool
Reviews.Content: Lovely, lovely hotel. The staff were caring, capable and efficient. Breakfast pricey but good. Room very nicely appointed. Walking distance to everything you need. Rue Dauphine is quite noisy all night long though, so ask for a room in the rear of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tman07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days in June, found the hotel on trip advisor and we were very pleased, the service, cleanliness (room good size, bathroom clean) and location was great. The desk set up all of our dinner reservations, they were perfect. The central location of the hotel could not have been better, walked everywhere, shopping, cafe' etc. We took a bike tour, trained to Normandy and Versailles, overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: foodfanUk
Reviews.Content: The room was neat, tidy and comfortable but a little too hot all the time (only a small gripe). The only other fault was it looked onto the road and it could be a little noisy at times. The service was excellent both at reception and elsehwere. The location is brilliant on the Left Bank but very near the Ile de la Cite.

Reviews.Title: “The # 1 in Paris - Best Possible”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Family_Trips
Reviews.Content: Wow!! I absolutely loved this hotel. The location is awesome. It is in Rue Dauphine which is right off Pont Neuf. This hotel would appeal to all ages. What I love the most is the non peretentious attitude of the staff. It is in a 17th Century Building so it does not have a grand intimidating entrance, instead you are welcomed by the wonderful staff at reception. The rooms are cosy and, unlike other 4 star hotels, they give you little treats such as chocolates and fresh roses in the room. I had my birthday at the hotel and the staff were so kind to me. I will never forget this wonderful trip to Paris. During my stay I visited the Ritz, Crillion and Bristol Hotels. Whilst they are beautiful, they lack the most important element - friendliness!!! The breakfast was wonderful. I am happy for anyone to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - the best hotel in Paris!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulDK
Reviews.Content: I have just returned to the D'Aubusson for the second time. I am a travel agent and am always on the lookout for a hotel that I could confidently recommend to people. I stayed here last year and was tempted to stay elsewhere this year but decided to try this hotel again - and I am so glad that I did. The same staff are here (which is always a great indication that it is a well run hotel). It is, as other reviewers have ,mentioned, a perfect location - equi distant to everything. Above all, I feel it is the welcoming feel that makes this hotel stand out for me. It is like a home away from home. The staff are so accommodating. The rooms are incredibly comfortable. The communication with the hotel when booking was fast and efficient. This is a true find that you will keep coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: FoodieLafayette
Reviews.Content: We returned to Hotel D'Aubusson for a second visit, and were just as impressed as the first time. The location is excellent - within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre, D'Orsay Museum, Luxembourg Garden, etc. we even walked to the Eiffel Tower (we like to walk). Enzo, at the front desk, greeted us by name before we said a word, and welcomed us back. We stayed in a junior suite as part of the Romance Package. The package included 2 tickets to the Louvre, 2 tickets for a Seine river cruise, 2 tickets to a musical performance in St. Chapelle (front row seats, no less), transfer from the airport to the hotel, lunch at the hotel, 10% off the room rate, flowers, champagne, and other little gifts. Breakfast each morning was also included. One great thing about this deal was that they guaranteed our rate in U.S. dollars - that was definitely to our benefit! Our room was quite large and nicely decorated. We loved the beamed ceilings and beautiful windows. The bathroom was also well designed and large. The staff is superb, and Enzo provided a lot of helpful information regarding transportation and restaurants. We can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of charm in the city of lights”
Reviews.Author: UmaS
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay in Paris, our first visit there, and were thrilled with Hotel d'Aubusson. Our room was nicely decorated, nicely sized, and very quiet. We appreciated the twice daily room service, nightly chocolate treats and next day's weather report, the two bottles of champagne, box of macarons and luggage tags that were left for us. The hotel's lobby is elegant and inviting. The dining room, with its Aubusson rug where we enjoyed a complimentary daily breakfast of coffee, tea, hot chocolate, juices, hot foods, meats and cheeses, breads and pastries, fruit, cereals, yogurt, is cozy. There is outdoor seating, as well. We enjoyed coming home in the evenings(Wed. through Sat.) to listen to jazz in the hotel's Cafe Laurent, a well known musical venue. From the front desk staff and concierges to the doormen, Cafe Laurent and dining room staff to housekeeping, we experienced only warmth and kindness, and a genuine concern that guests have a wonderful stay. The location, in bustling St. Germain des Pres, a short walk from the Pont Neuf, the islands, the Louvre and Luxembourg Gardens, can't be beat. There are several metro stations, as well as a taxi stand, only blocks away. The area is full of restaurants, cafes, bistros, boulangeries and patisseries. With its charming interior and dedicated, first rate staff, Hotel d'Aubusson was truly a home away from home for us. Our stay there helped make our first(and hopefully not our last) trip to Paris a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: benezet
Reviews.Content: We recently had a wonderful seven day stay at the Hotel d'Aubusson. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and polite. We had a problem getting a borrowed DVD to play in English and someone was sent up immediately to help us. It is a perfect size hotel--not too small, not too big. The location is amazing, being within walking distance of many sites in Paris as well as near several metro stops (Odeon, St. Michel). Our room, loft 501, was very clean and clearly kept up. We have a nearly 14 year old and an 11 year old and this room was ideal with a queen size bed on the main level and a sofa lounge bed in the loft, and then a room off the loft area with a twin bed. We heard no noise from other rooms, which is always important. We had done the summer promotion so we got the free breakfast, which is much more than a continental breakfast but less than say a full American breakfast. The breakfast was very tasty and filling and a huge convenience just to quickly eat before out for the day. I would not, however, pay the 25 euros per person for the breakfast. My only complaint is similar to one made by another guest staying in a loft room--the room needs to have another air conditioning unit in the loft area. The loft area was definitely warmer than the ground floor of the room, although not unbearably warm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelpoetnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. From the welcoming front desk staff, to the maids, bartenders, and door staff, I felt at home. My room was large, comfortable, and the bathroom huge. The tub a bit narrow and it did take me a bit to get the â€œshower-thingâ€� down, everything else perfect. Great bedding, dark curtains, and delicious chocolate covered nuts await me at nights end. On two of the days constructions started to early for me, before eight, and I called (emailed) the front desk in within moments the noise stopped. Very responsive staff. The location is perfect, a short walk to what you want in Paris cafÃ© life, or a short walk to the Pont Neuf Bridge for the ferry down the Seine. Breakfast buffet, filled with eggs, fruit, yogurt, baguettes, and more.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, friendly, loads of charm”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasTravelhog
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The staff were very helpful and the room was a nice size and beds were comfortable. The public areas were very nice also--breakfast room, sitting room, lounge and outside eating area. We did the summer promotion like others have mentioned and really enjoyed the nice, relaxing breakfast before our hectic fast paced tourist schedule took us away. The Rue de Buci was just a few blocks away and was a favorite spot to walk to for cafe life. We walked to everything from this spot and really only used the metro to arrive and depart. I can't stop thinking about our trip! I loved Paris and both of the Hotels we picked (the other was Hotel Ares Eiffel). I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, warm, well located, welcoming, accomodating”
Reviews.Author: cath116
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old granddaughter and I stayed here for a week. It was her first trip to Paris, and we couldn't have selected a better hotel for our adventure. The staff and service were all wonderful. The staff knew our names within the first hour, and were incredibly helpful with suggestions for dinners, with directions, etc. We had some issues with our wireless connection at first - within 15 minutes someone came to repair it. The location is superb - if we turned right we were a block from the Pont Neuf, if we turned left we were at the Rue de Baci with its myriad cafes and a block from the metro. Our beamed ceiling room was large and quiet. The public spaces are lovely. I had stayed here years ago with my husband and son, and the d'Aubusson is even more charming than I had remembered. I will definitely return on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great staff and non-chain feel”
Reviews.Author: Garyd57
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Paris and this one really manages to mix all the elements of very truly helpful staff, great location, nice, quiet rooms and good breakfast. I plan to stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “C'est bon!”
Reviews.Author: JB_and_KB
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic boutique Parisian hotel in an incredible location. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Notre Dame Cathedral and The Lourvre. There are about 30 restaurantes within a 5 minute walk and it is a half of a block to the Seine. The staff could not have been more accomodating! We had a loft room on the top floor for ourselves and our two teenagers, and it was quite spacious. The staff were all very accomodating and spoke perfect English. On Wed thru Saturday, they have live jazz music in the bar which brings in a hip, youger crowd. We could not have been happier with our choice of hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Why look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: jtoakey
Reviews.Content: What a great location. A few blocks to Blvd Ste. Germain des Pres, shopping, Les Deaus Magots.. in one direction and one two blocks to the Seine. Easy walking to Luxemborg gardens, the Latin Quarter, notre Dame, the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre. Unbelievably helpful staff in EVERY regard and good late night music in Cafe Laurent Wed-Sat. The Romance Package was a great deal including airport transport, champagne, a luncheon, daily breakfast, d'Orsay or Louvre tickets (no waiting in lines), seine river cruise tickets and tickets to classical concert at Ste Chapelle. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good as usual”
Reviews.Author: ParisDreamin'
Reviews.Content: We returned to the d'Aubusson for our first stay there in about 3 years. We continue to love the location, in the 6th, but a stone's throw away from the Pont Neuf and therefore close to many major sights. We stayed in the regular Queen Superior room on this stay. A little tighter than the Grand Luxe room that we've stayed in typically in the past, but still adequate for us. The room looked a little more frayed around the edges than the room that we had on our last visit, although I suspect that it's just regular wear and tear from 3 more years without a renovation. That being said, it was nice, a solid typical 4 star hotel room for Paris. Service, which I have always felt to be the strong suit of this hotel, was good as usual, although perhaps not quite as good as on our last visit (the staff appears to have largely changed). But they were all still attentive and helpful, particularly with our detailed dinner reservation arrangements. Breakfast remains pretty good, although I still struggle every time I go to Europe a little with the runny, watery scrambled eggs. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit. It's not the George V or the Plaza Athenee, but it's also only two-fifths the price. Still one of the best Paris 4-stars that we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: BonVivant57
Reviews.Content: The best part of our stay was the staff. Everyone at the Hotel was very attentive and knowledgable. The staff was multi lingual. Breakfast was included and was terrific. The location was great with access to two metro lines an easy walk. Initially we stayed in the Duplex/Loft. The room was large by European standards. Unfortunately the room was HOT, especially upstairs. Fans were provided which made the room tolerable at best. We moved to the fourth floor and had connecting rooms which were much cooler. The sheets had the texture of sand paper if that matters. The WiFi at the Hotel is TERRIBLE. We wre unable to log on from our room and many other areas of the hotel. There is a computer in the lobby that can be used but is not a substitute to having your own PC. This was very disappointing as we rely heavily on the web to plan/modify our trip. Overall nice hotel with great staff that needs a few tweaks.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel2009
Reviews.Content: Overall it is a nice hotel. But definetely not excellent. I think it is not value for money. We had paid 1000 euros for 3-night stay and were upgraded to junior suite. But even there the bed was very short, the bathroom was very cold in the mornings. The breakfast was ok and location is excellent! Unfortunately, the staff there was not great. We had tickets to classical concert included in our package but staff has directed us to the wrong place so we missed it!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great city !!”
Reviews.Author: CJV_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the d'Aubusson for our first visit to Paris. Our decision to stay at the hotel was influenced by previous Trip Advisor reviews and our experience exceeded even our high expectaions. We booked the "Romance Package" which included a pickup at CDG, a boatride on the Seine, a concert at St. Chapelle, tickets to the Louvre, breakfast, and a champagne luncheon in the courtyard. As noted by other guests, the location is great and the gracious staff significantly contributed to our experience. Before visiting I exchanged numerous emails with Laurent on the concierge staff to pre-plan some activities and dinner plans, especially since this was our first trip to Paris. He was always very prompt and detailed in his responses and his suggestions were all great. The other members of the concierge staff were also very helpful after we arrived. Our room was very quiet and comfortable and the public areas were very nicely appointed. Even had a PC available for guest use since I retired recently and do not have a BB or carry a laptop these days. Overall, we have stayed at many hotels around Europe in Italy, Belgium, UK, Sweden and Irelend and we found the d'Aubusson to be a first class establishment. Wouldn't think of staying any place else when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel pretty much has it all”
Reviews.Author: rickhlosangeles_CA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from six nights here...read all the reviews on this website and have to agree with most of it. Perfect location in the 6th arrondisment, 5 minutes to Metro, 2 minutes to Pont Neuf/Seine. Lots of great eats within 5 minues.Front desk was very accomodating and upgraded us after seeing our small Classic Room. Upgrade was nicer, bathrooms nicely appointed (though water switched from hot to cold quite often) Lots of great help from Jean at the front desk as far as restaurants, directions, etc. Breakfast buffet was excellent and a great way to start a day of walking the city. Only negative was the price, but that's what 4 star hotels in Paris charge I guess. Found best deal on hotel's website with free night, breakfast and limo pick up at airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: starynight
Reviews.Content: I feel it necessary to respond to the previous reviewer's comments, since they seem totally out of character with the Hotel d'Aubusson. I have been a client for many years now and have stayed at the Aubusson on numerous occasions. I have recommended the hotel to friends who have stayed here as well. The hotel is well managed and well situated, the rooms are lovely, well equipped, reasonably sized, and immaculate. The staff could not be more accommodating. The breakfast room is delightful and the breakfast choices and quality of food is very good. I have never found the hotel to be noisy, though I typically request a room on the rue Christine side of the hotel. The Aubusson is within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Ile St Louis and the Louvre, many restaurants and shops, and is convenient to at least 4 metro stops. It's a great boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SBrantley
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews of this hotel, it turned out to be a real disappointment. The only good part was the staff at the front desk. Otherwise, be aware if you stay at this property that you can hear nearly everything from the street and the rooms next to yours. We were in room 304 (a superior room at 315 euro) originally; the noise from 305 was unbelievable and when we complained to the front desk staff they moved us to room 505 which was considered an "upgrade" (duplex/loft room for 398 euro). It looked and felt like a dungeon - with one tiny window. It was also considerably smaller than our original room but it was quiet. If you stay here, skip the rate that includes breakfast -- the food is atrocious and so is the service. You could gag on the coffee - itâ€™s that bad. The positives about this hotel are its great location on the Left Bank and its proximity to Notre Dame and the Metro. But the positives, in our view, didnâ€™t outweigh the negatives and we wonâ€™t return when weâ€™re in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest stay on our whole trip”
Reviews.Author: hikester
Reviews.Content: A small hotel whose absolutely charming staff make you forget that Paris is supposed to be incredibly hostile and unhelpful to Americans. Directions, reservations, cabs; all gotten easily. My French not only tolerated but coached. A terrific jazz bar. Boat ride and Louvre tickets included with room. Clean room with double-paned windows so absolutely silent. Fantastic breakfast with perfectly ripe cheeses, flaky croissants, dates and figs, etc. Valentine's Day we found Cartier (? sounds odd, doesn't it) boxes with chocolate hearts in our room. Before our early departure (5 am), staff rushed up with freshly arrived croissants, rolls, coffee and juice and had a bellman at our door the second the cab arrived. Our stay here was just delightful and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Celina28
Reviews.Content: It has taken me some time to write this review but since there are so many terrible hotels in Paris this is quite a find and I had to share my views too. If you are looking for a intimate hotel, with great character and in a great location this is it. I arrived at 8am when the hotel was only meant to be ready at midday, the staff were great and gave me a room straight away. The room was neat and tidy and had all the amenities that I needed to feel at home. Location wise a 5 minute walk and you hit the river with the Louvre museum straight ahead, Notre Dame to your left and an abundance of cafes and restaurants. In the night there was live music at the bar and what better than a drink and live music to enjoy after a long day sight seeing. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful too. Breakfast was great with many little pastries and breads as well as cold cuts, fruits, cereal and freshly brewed coffee. Overall the hotel is quite expensicve in comparison to other 3 - 4 star hotels but it made my 4 day trip to Paris unforgettable. I do intend to return to Paris in a year and this is where I intend to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Warm, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: funkytravelerA2
Reviews.Content: Had a perfect stay of four days over New Year's this year. This smallish hotel is so charming that we really wished we had stayed longer. The room was decorated so 'Parisian Wonderful', with every detail provided...even little linens draped on the headboard when they turned the bed down at night. The staff was first-class. They promptly honored every request. The breakfast was very good each morning, could not stop eating the fresh croissants and drinking the best coffee I may have ever had. The location is really this hotel's best asset. Just walk out the door and Notre Dame and the Ile de la Cite just around the corner, all the major attractions are a short walk, just down the alley lies dozens of small incredible restaurants, galleries abound. This is probably the very best left bank location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, superb customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dylaur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with another couple for our 10 year anniversary. We booked the "romance package". As Americans going to Europe for our first time, we had a hard time making a decision on where to stay in Paris. Everyone we spoke with had another suggestion. We undoubtedly made the right choice. The hotel was clean, formal, and the rooms were a good size. The breakfast was good and the staff made every attempt to get you what you wanted. Most important to us was the front desk. They went above and beyond to direct us, get tickets to shows, and help with our daily itinerary. We especially enjoyed being in a neighborhood as opposed to a commercial area. Many restaurants and bakeries within walking distance. Using their subway system was also easy with a station a 7 minute walk away. Overall, excellent location and superb customer service at this hotel led to a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toronto1999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel during our honeymoon over Christmas of last year. We had an amazing experience and loved everything about this hotel. The location was ideal as it was an easy, short walk to the Notre Dame, the Seine, the Latin Quarter and the Louvre. The hotel was situated on a beautiful, quiet street and the actual property was immaculate and romantic. Sitting by the fireplace in the lounge late at night was the perfect ending to a romantic day in a beautiful city. Our room was comfortable and cozy. The best thing about this hotel was it's wonderful staff that went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay. Jean was incredibly helpful and truly made our honeymoon special. His friendliness made us feel right at home in Paris! This was the best hotel we have ever stayed at!! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon experience.”
Reviews.Author: stonedtemple_pilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel D'Aubusson last year for my honeymoon, and my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is on a cute, quiet street very close to the river, and is within walking distance of many great restaurants & cafes, the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, etc. We were there just after Christmas, and the lounge had a beautiful tree, and an enormous, beautiful fireplace that was the perfect place to sit and have a drink in front of while warming up. The staff was as friendly and helpful as we could ever imagine. They made us feel as welcome as if we were staying with family. Jean in particular made us feel at home. He seemed to work mostly at night, and helped us feel happy and comfortable even though we had serious jet lag. He gave us great advice on what to do & where to go at 3 am when we couldn't sleep! I would HIGHLY recommed staying at the Hotel D'Aubusson again. I can't wait to go back and stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: berniss
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in the Saint Germaine area and looked at TripAdvisor for a hotel that was well regarded. This hotel popped out. I looked at the website and noticed that they were offering specials that brought down the prices during the time period I was visiting. There were four categories of rooms and I booked the second category. When we arrived, our room wasn't available and we were exhausted and needed to sleep immediately. We opted to upgrade to the next category in order to get some sleep. The difference was $50 EU which isn't really worth it for a bit more space, unless you get a really special room. I was a bit disappointed that they didn't offer to upgrade us. However, they made up for it on our last day, when they credited us $50 EU back and let us keep the room until 5pm. It still cost us more for two days. There are Hermes soaps and shampoos, robes, slippers, scale, a hair dryer and there was a turn down. One day we we found a jar of poached pears left for us. There is also free internet, though it is somewhat cumbersome to use. The service at the hotel was was lovely. We were offered to be awakened each morning with coffee, tea or hot chocolate. The breakfast buffet was included and seemed to stay open well past what it was supposed to. There was live jazz Wed through Sun in the lounge and a lovely Salon with a fireplace to take tea. Our package included two tickets to the Louvre or D'Orsay, a river cruise, and a tea during our stay and breakfast each day. The concierge was lovely and the staff was warm and friendly. The ambience of the hotel was understated and 15th century. The location was amidst cafes and one block from the Pont Neuf. We could easily walk to the Louvre, the D'Orsay, the Notre Dame...Metro stops....restaurants I will definitely stay there again. It was well priced for a Paris hotel and the location was superb. I found it very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, noisy, and uncomfortable beds...”
Reviews.Author: ksvensson
Reviews.Content: We were terribly disappointed with our two night stay at Hotel D'Aubusson in late November. I had reserved it because all the rave reviews and high rating on Trip Advisor, and chose the hotel over other hotels I had stayed before with lower rating. I kept wishing I had not followed the advise... We arrived and were told we got an upgrade from a basic to a slightly better room. It had a king-size bed and it was a nice-size room, BUT it was on the second floor above a noisy, narrow road. Both me and my husband had to use ear-plugs! The worst thing was a huge, very noticable "valley" in my husband's bed, which made for back ache and bad sleep. We complained in the morning and were transfered to a smaller room all the way through a court yard, the breakfast room, salon, up two flights of stairs (no elevator). The room was tiny, but otherwise ok. Beds were ok (no holes) but not much more. Again, after this experience, I will think twice before I book based on Trip Advisor's ratings, and will for sure not return to Hotel D'Aubusson!

Reviews.Title: “The Romance in Paris package is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: EastHamptonGinger
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The location is ideal, the neighborhood is interesting with lots of wonderful shops and cafes. The staff of the hotel could not be more accommodating, the service is excellent. There are many special touches here that make for a very personal and memorable visit. It's like having your own apartment in Paris. Special Tip: be sure to ask for a "Grande Luxe Apartment" otherwise you may not be happy with the size of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mmwrpelletier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from Canada, visiting Paris for 7 days as part of a medical conference. We stayed for the first 3 nights at a large hotel in Montparnasse (Meridien, similar to a large Hilton or Marriott) but knew that for our last 3 days we wanted to stay in the best area of the city, in the Latin Quarter, close to landmarks, an easy walk to anything cool in Paris. We did our research, spoke to friends who had stayed in Paris, and took an educated gamble on this hotel. We are in our late 30's, married for 13 years, and were leaving our kids at home for the first time. There truly could not be a better hotel for us. We've travelled throughout US and North America, and have a good feeling for what we wanted. The problem with Paris hotels is often that they have small rooms and staff is not friendly. Nothing could be further from the truth at this hotel. The rooms are very reasonable in size. We paid a bit more, stayed on the top (5th) floor, in the Edith Piaf room. Very large, nice Queen bed, nice bathroom. Lots of light. Not a great view, but you don't stay in a hotel for the view. The staff is really, really nice. Always smiling. We speak French, but they speak English very well. The breakfast is wonderful: eggs, bacon, sausage, croissants, fresh-squeezed orange juice, etc... Every day there is a nice fire in a very large fireplace. Every time we got back to our room, there was a little treat: A bottle of champagne our first day. Chocolates our 2nd day. Tags for our bags the 3rd day. There is a very nice little bar downstairs, with Jazz on Thur-Sat nights. Think about it: sitting by the fire, sipping on a glass of wine, surfing my laptop (free WiFi) while a Jazz band plays 30-40 feet away. We saw many other hotels in this area, and I can't think of a better place to stay. The location is really the best. You can walk anywhere. There are great restaurants nearby (try Le Christine just 200 feet away). Fantastic place to stay. Can't see how anybody, even if you have crazy extravagant tastes, would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: i_luv_stj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in the Hotel d'Aubusson at the beginning of September and just loved it. The location is great - on a nice quiet street, but just a few blocks off of the happening St Michel/ St Germain area. There is a large market nearby for supplies, and even a laundromat down the street if you need it like we did after a month on the road. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, checking us in early with no fuss. The hotel has a beautiful small courtyard ideal for breakfast or a drink, as well as a beautiful dining area and bar/jazz club. Everything is near by - every type of restaurant from Joel Rubichon (L'Atelier) to late night crepe shops, good shopping, wine shops, etc. Major tourist sites are a short walk (Louvre, Pont Neuf, Hotel de Ville) or quick subway ride away. This is the perfect location to base your stay in Paris. We did not take breakfast since there were so many cafes near by, but did hear another couple raving about it. We stayed at another Paris hotel later in our stay in France and realized how great the location was for us at the Hotel d'Aubusson when compared to the other place we stayed. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel beyond compare”
Reviews.Author: ksag
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 weeks at Hotel d'Aubusson this month. It was our first trip to Paris; indeed, to Europe. From the point we booked the hotel via emails, it has been the most wonderful experience. The entire staff was a dream: accommodations for restaurants, travel arrangements to/from the airport, suggestions of walking tours, and always friendly, professional service. The hotel is beautiful and it is located in the center of Paris. For future visits to Paris, we intend to only stay at Hotel d'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was meant to be, after our first choice hotel in St Germain de Pres was fully booked, I decided to hit trip advisor and do my homework for another hotel. Couldn't pick fault if we tried, an absolute delight, fantastic location. Lovely rooms, nicely decorated and plenty of room ( for Paris). Large size bathroom. We received a very good rate inclusive many extras. The staff were more than helpful and obliged in every way. Breakfast abolutely delicious, freshly prepared and presented. The sitting area and paved courtyard was tranquil and an ideal place for a drink or a coffee. This is now our first choice of hotel for Paris, you couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “boutique bliss in paris”
Reviews.Author: beth06
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the D'Aubusson in a duplex room for 3 perfect nights!! We were greeted by the ever charming Laurent who made us feel so welcome!! The room was perfect for our 2 kids who had the downstairs and we had the upstairs room. The bathroom was large and beautiful! But the BEST part of the hotel was the concierge service provided by Laurent and Jean. Both gave us the best recommendations for restaurants, walking tours, cafes, and just their professionalism and charm were fantastic!!! If you are planning a trip to Paris, St Germain des Pres and the Hotel D'Aubusson are the perfect combination!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very central”
Reviews.Author: RobertKaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel d'Aubusson for 9 days in April. The hotel is on Rue Dauphine about 300 metres from the Seine at Pont Neuf. Our room was spacious with a turndown service every night. Bathroom was large and the toiletries were of great quality. We had the usual leaking shower but we have encountered that in 9 out of 10 hotels in Europe. Walking distance to Rue St Michelle, some great restaurants and various metro stations. The staff were very helpful and polite. Breakfast (not included in the price) was not bad but we ended up at some patisserie most mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: arjm2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location on the left bank just a block from Pont Neuf to the north and Bucy market/St. Germain blvd to the south. We walked everywhere! The staff were fluent in English and very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small by North American standards but faily typical by European and the bathrooms large. The room was very clean. The street is not terribly busy and the double windows make the rooms very quiet. Nearly every night there was a little gift left in our room - a half bottle of champagne, macaroons, etc. We had booked on the summer special which we found quite economical as it included a one way ride to the airport in a lovely Mercedes, tickets to the Louvre and a river cruise. This also included a buffet breakfeast which was very extensive (pasteries, eggs, bacon, cereal, cafe au lait). We were travelling with a 5 month old baby and the staff was very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGOOD58
Reviews.Content: It was our second time staying at the D'Aubusson. It's the perfect hotel for us in Paris - great location, excellent service and comfortable rooms. The hotel is incredibly charming, but has all the amenities you need. For us, there is no reason to try any other hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTripster
Reviews.Content: Hotel D'Aubusson is in a wonderful location -- near Pont Neuf and within walking distance of many Parisian sights and near a trove of great bistros and cafes. What distinguishes the Hotel is the great staff. Vivi at the front desk recommended a number of restaurants that we found to be outstanding. Other staff were helpful with directions and transportation needs. The Hotel is very cozy. On one cool evening, they had a fire in the fireplace in the salon. The breakfast, which is included, is a delicious and ample buffet. The bar had a jazz band one evening and it was very lively. D'Aubusson might not be for everyone -- it is in a very busy area, somewhat youngish, with a lot going on. However, we found the activity energizing and the convenience of really delicious bistros hard to beat. We have stayed on previous trips at the Bristol and the Plaza Athene and we regard the D'Aubusson as a great place to stay. Happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyPug2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights and we had a wonderful time at the hotel. The front desk was very helpful, the location of the hotel was perfect (close to the river and Rue Buci where there is a lot going on at night) and we enjoyed the quaint feel in the lounge/bar area. We absolutely adored the decor of our room as well as enjoyed the central courtyard for a mid afternoon glass of champagne. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mpwineca
Reviews.Content: Outstanding in every respect. I made arrangements with the concierge in advance of arrival for some champagne and flowers in the room for my wife's birthday. The instructions were carried out perfectly and to great effect! Room was beautiful and the bath was large and beautifully appointed. The d'Aubusson is in a perfect Left Bank location that is also near the Louvre and other popular Right Bank sights.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of Paris”
Reviews.Author: AleksinToronto
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler to five star hotels in Europe and beyond, I was mesmerized by this little jewel in St Germain during my partner's and my 5 night stay there in late May/early June. From the moment I contacted the hotel from Toronto to make various travel and dinner arrangements to the time that we left the property's doors, we were treated with the just the right balance of warmth and professionalism that all 4 and 5 star properties aspire to but so rarely achieve. To be sure, you could rest your head at Le Meurice or Plaza AthenÃ©e and have every luxury at your disposal, but will every single member of staff greet you by name and tailor their service to your evey whim? Will a bottle of champagne with a hand-written concierge letter of genuine disappointment be waiting for you when a 3 Michelin star restaurant drops your dinner rsvp last-minute even though it is of no fault of the hotel whatsoever? And will your prized hotel have front desk personnel like Enzo, Jean, Audrey, and Frederic who will put various entertainment and dining options at your disposal without even asking? (As an example, my partner and I returned from dinner one night to be informed that, knowing we were often out late at night and probably interested in Paris's night scene, Jean had gone ahead and contacted some friends who owned one of the city's most luminous bars and that "everything had been taken care of"). And this is just about the service. The rooms themselves are a seamless mix of new and old: history abounds everywhere in this boutique jewel from the exposed beam chambres to the jazz bar frequented by some of Paris's greatest thinkers for more than two centuries; and yet when you're bathing in Hermes products and enjoying high definition television, it's hard to remember at times that you're away from home. The enchanting private courtyard flowing from the lobby spills into a stunning, original fireplaced family room adorned with accoutrements that remain true to the hotel's storied history wihout feeling stuffy. You can sense eveywhere you look in this property, and in everything you touch, that great thought and love has been put foward to making this the jewel of Paris. Rest assured, even if you're not choosing to rest your head and your spirit at the d'Aubusson on your next trip to Paris, I certainly will be. -Aleks in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “wonderful room in great location”
Reviews.Author: Paris1scarf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great trip to France, spending last night in Paris, awaiting flight. The Hotel d"Aubusson was a perfect venue for this last day/night. Located in an old building in St. Germain, near river, museums, food, etc., this easy to miss small hotel has a charming lobby, friendly staff, small bar that has live jazz, or a quiet salon for your computing or drinks. Our deluxe room was quiet and spacious, with a very comfortable bed. The bath was modern, appeared newly renovated, and provided Hermes soap and products. The staff recommended great lunch and dinner suggestions. Try the "Vagenade" Bistro on St. Germain (roast chicken is fabulous) or the "Marinara" wood oven pizza/ fresh pasta restaurant that was filled with locals!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Me_Too_As_Well
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in October 2006, having picked the hotel from a 'Top 10' Paris guide. We booked directly through the hotel website, and opted for their 'Romance' package (I need all the help I can get . . . !). That came with a pick-up from the station, a bottle of champagne and a dozen red roses on arrival, two free tickets for a Seine cruise, two free passes for the Louvre, and a champagne lunch. The hotel is absolutely fantastic - very friendly staff, great service, perfect buffet breakfast, a lovely sitting room with log fire in the evening, and very comfortable rooms. It offers the perfect location to explore the city by metro or on foot. We'll definitely to stay at the Hotel d'Aubusson when we visit Paris in future. (p.s. worth eating at Brasserie Bofingers and L'Epi Dupin - the hotel will book for you!)

Reviews.Title: “A Winning Hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyWanderlust
Reviews.Content: With the value of the dollar falling and my taste in hotels being 5- star, I decided to find a boutique hotel on the left bank with a good package. After a thorough investigation, I booked the honeymoon package at the Hotel d'Aubusson for 6 nights with my husband. We laughed at the name of the package, as we've been married for 37 years, but this could indeed be suited for honeymooners. Everything was terrific. Included for 400 Euros a night was a personal driver who picked us up at the airport. After waiting just 10 minutes upon arrival at 10 a.m., we were brought to a spacious luxury room where a dozen roses were sitting on the coffee table. The flowers stayed in bloom for our complete stay. We were given a buffet breakfast each day set in a beautiful room with old beamed ceilings. Other perks were small gifts left for us each day in our room including a split of champagne, luggage tags, a fabulous gourmet champagne lunch, admission to a museum and tickets for the Baton Mouche. There might have been more but I can't remember. The best part about the hotel was it's location. We walked everywhere. We were surrounded by excellent bistros, good shopping and nearby musuems and sightseeing. We especially enjoyed Paris Walks, a company that gives daily walking tours. You can find them at www.---.com. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. They made dinner reservations upon our request, and we truly enjoyed both of Guy Savoy's baby bistros, Les Bouquinistes which was just around the corner and Atelier Maitre Albert which was a quick 10-minlute walk from the hotel. Both restaurants had waiters who spoke fluent English, and the menus were translated although they were filled with Parisians. Friends of ours stayed around the corner from us at Relais Christine and thought our hotel was much prettier and a better deal. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I Should Definately Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: doly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel d' Aubusson for 3 nights. We were very pleased that we chose this hotel. The staff was extremely helpfull they made for us everything we needed, like airplane e-ticketing confirmation and restaurant reservation. The quality of the products at breakfast was very selective. The hotel ambiance is very relaxing, in general. Its position its literally close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the d'Aubusson!!”
Reviews.Author: jeanniedc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 wonderful nights at this hotel, which I had also stayed at about 2 years ago. There are so many great things about the d'Aubusson. First is the location; absolutely perfect. Can walk everywhere, easy access to Right bank across Pont Neuf, and of course many parts of Left Bank. Very lively and safe area (I was with my 14 year old daughter; husband not with us this time). Other assets: room size is large for Paris, bathroom very nice, large with good space to put everything. We had a package that included breakfast. I wouldn't have gotten this on a longer trip or in the warm weather when we could eat outside at a cafe (and it's fun to try different ones) , but it was very convenient for our brief winter trip.
