The breakfast was awesome with fabulous service!! Other nice feature of hotel: the front desk staff is wonderful. Always friendly, and allowed me to speak to them in French without speaking back to me in English! They made all our dinner reservations in advance by e-mail. If I had any complaints, it was just one thing: I had asked for a quiet courtyard room so as to avoid the sound of the jazz band on the weekends. Unfortunately, we were put in a street-view room that was above the Cafe Laurent where the band was. Even though we were on the third floor, we could still hear the music. Thankfully, my very good earplugs helped so I did not ask to change rooms. I would recommend this hotel highly. It's not cheap, but it makes for a wonderful experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: heysarahbeth
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just stayed 6 nights here over New Years 2008. We had a great experience in Paris thanks to the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly & helpful. We had difficulty with the language, but mostly everyone spoke English to accomodate us. We were upgraded 2 room levels on arrival, which was a pleasant surprise. The rooms were very clean. They had turn down service & there was always a little treat waiting for us in the evening (i.e. orange candy, chocolates, pears). The concierge was helpful. The front desk made dinner reservations & booked a train to Belgium for us. The buffet breakfast was a nice addition - cheese platter, large assortment of breads & pastries, cold cereal & but a relatively small selection of hot food by American standards (i guess my complant is that it was the same food every day - never changed). The steamed milk with coffee was good. The location is great! So many restaurants in the immediate vicinity. We walked everywhere. I read reviews about the loud music from the bar & noisy street. However, we didn't hear ANY noise from our room. I would definitely recommend this boutique hotel & would go back myself!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Nonrevpej
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, great hotel staff service, very nice breakfast, and super quiet location. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, superb service”
Reviews.Author: John-Draper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location off the Boulevard Saint Germain. We stayed for a long weekend. Our room was quiet, had huge oak beams, and was quite large for Paris, with a king-size bed. Luxury bathroom with Hermes soaps etc. The service was very friendly and really excellent (a birthday card on my birthday!). Breakfast in the restaurant is expensive and not outstanding, but there are lots of good cafe's close by. Room service breakfast is better value. The hotel is within walking distance of the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay (they got tickets for us so we avoided queueing), Luxembourg Gardens, and close to several excellent restaurants. It is quite pricey but this is justified by the quality of the service, the rooms and the location. Highly recommended, you really won't be disappointed. We've stayed in other highly-rated Paris hotels but this is the best so far. We'll definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Vitina
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just spent 7 days shopping in Paris and loved staying at this cozy hotel. It was my forth time and I will be going back again. The bar and jazz at night made it special and the breakfast is also great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week in late October 2007. We chose it due to the excellent reviews we have read but mostly for the location. It was two blocks from the Seine and Pont Neuf. Therefore, we could easily walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, San Chapelle, The Orangerie, The Cluny and many other sites on our list. The Odeon metro stations was a 4 minute walk. The room had wifi (not free) which we needed for our business. Before we arrived we had contacted the concierge to make a few dinner reservations for us which went perfectly. While there, the staff was helpful when we needed them. We did not buy the breakfast package as we preferred to do it the Parisian way and start at a cafe every day. The only strange thing was that housekeeping showed up at about 10pm each night for turn down service which was not convenient but hardly anything to complain about. The rooms were pretty and very clean. I would recommend this place. Do not expect to get into your room one minute before check in time. Jet lagged or not, it was made clear to us that this would not happen. Though we landed at 7am, we gained at access to the room at 3 pm. So, plan your first day with that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights! It is a very friendly place with wonderful staff. You feel like old friends from the moment you are met at the airport! We had the 'romance package' which included the pickup service, a lovely room (we were upgraded to a loft suite), breakfast, special treats, tickets to the Louvre, Champagne lunch, a boat ride down the Seine etc etc etc. We had a wonderful stay and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Gem in the Center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: seery1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in October. We stayed in the Edith Piaf suite. THe best deal on the hotel webite was the romance package. It included transport from the airport, breakfast, champagne and flowers and tickets to several Paris locals. For the price and location this place can't be beat. It is near almost every major attraction, yet in a quiet neighborhood. Staff very friendly. We have stayed in other Paris hotels, and this has been our favorite so far. Tres Bien.

Reviews.Title: “No Disappointments - Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: CM601
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 5 days in Paris. The hotel is one half block from the Pont Neuf bridge on the Seine. Lots of close by cafe's, bistro's, pasterie's, shops etc. We ate breakfast at Chez Paul's, a 5 minute walk for a great breakfast and less $$ than the hotel. We stayed in a standard room which was small but adequite, which had a small desk, night stands, TV stand and chair, nice bathroom. The Hotel is very clean, not worn, service is excellent, hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. A nice fruit gift was in our room every evening when we returned. We would stay again, if we were to go back to Paris. Although this has nothing to do with the hotel you should be advised....One leason learned with the Taxi's... if you hale a cab the meter starts when you get in, but, if a taxi is called for you, the meter starts from where ever the taxi begins his trip to pick you up. Thinking the taxi driver was a rip-off, this policy was later confirmed with the hotel staff. Seemed like most popular places in town were around a $6 eur taxi (haled) ride from the hotel. Use the Metro when possible about 10 minute walk to St. Michael Metro and the RER..

Reviews.Title: “Adored Hotel d'Aubusson”
Reviews.Author: Aypril
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel d'Aubusson on my first trip to Paris in early September, 2007. I was there for almost two weeks and was extremely happy that I chose this charming, first rate hotel. All of the staff were exceptionally polite and helpful. I cannot remember any service I have experienced anywhere that was better than theirs. After I'd spoken with some of the staff more than once or twice, they had big smiles for me thereafter, something the French don't usually produce for total strangers. I had a "superior" room that I thought was very large by French standards for one person. I didn't book any special packages, but they had a lovely, large bouquet of Stargazer lilies in my room when I arrived. Every other night I received a gift in my room when I returned. A split of champagne, a giant brioche in their beautiful navy and gold box, a small fruit basket, a lovely jar of miniature pears in syrup, and eventually, a three drawer box of chocolates and other lovely candies. I don't know if they do this for guests who stay longer than a few days or what, but it was a wonderful surprise. I had planned my own itinerary, so I didn't need to bother the staff too much, but when I had a question, they were unfailingly polite and helpful. My room was always clean. And every night in addition to the candied orange bonbons and "Good Night" card they leave for everyone (in memory of Robespierre who often visited their establishment in the 1700s and ate oranges when they were a new fruit for France), they also leave another card with the name of the person who cleaned your room and the weather forcast for the next day. That forecast came in handy for me. My room was on the third floor in the corner, which is directly above the Cafe Laurent. I did notice some noise the first night, which was a Saturday, but I was eventually able to sleep anyway. After that weekend, I didn't notice any noise. The location is terrific for sightseeing and shopping. I was five minutes away from the Pont Neuf and Notre Dame, a great cheese shop, great bakery (one of many in the area), a well stocked little market, several good cafes and a ten minute walk from Patrick Roget's chocolate shop on the Boulevard Saint-Germain. It was about a 20 to 30 minute walk to the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. I had room service a few times (their pizza was excellent!) but did not eat other meals at the hotel. Their dining room, the eating area in the cafe and their beautful courtyard all seemed lovely to me. As a single woman traveling alone, I liked that the street was somewhat busy, but not overly so. The Relais Christine just down a side street was a little too isolated for me to have felt comfortable walking down their street at night--even if it was safe. The Rue de Buci, just down the street and around the corner was great for eating and people watching, but much busier day and night. If I ever have a chance to go back to Paris, I would want to return to Hotel d'Aubusson. It's a great little boutique hotel in a great location with a superior staff and it already feels like home to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Hotel D'Aubusson!”
Reviews.Author: hopkinz
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson July 1-5. A good friend stayed here during the winter and raved about the hotel and the service. We booked the Romance Package (not much romance with our 6 year old in tow) and it was worth every euro. Our stay in a deluxe room included a private transfer from the airport, roses and champagne in the room, tickets to the Louvre, breakfast each day, a bateau mouche ride, tickets to a concert and a delicious champagne lunch with foie gras. We considered staying on the Right Bank as we've done in the past, but we would have gotten much less for the same price. Our room was spacious by Paris standards. At first, I was disappointed that we didn't have one of the exposed beamed rooms they show on their website, but it turned out to not be a big deal. The rooms are super-soundproofed from street noise. We all slept very soundly. Since we weren't there over the weekend, I can't comment on the noise from the jazz band that plays in the lounge. The Hermes toiletries are a nice touch. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room and replenished all our toiletries daily. The staff is unfailingly polite and helpful. We asked for recommendations multiple nights for places to go for dinner and were never disappointed. We particularly liked the restaurant Aux Charpentiers, which is walking distance from the hotel. The neighborhood is wonderful and close to everything. There are lots of restaurants to choose from and great shopping (a wonderful children's clothing store is on the Rue Dauphine across the street from the hotel called Bois de Rose and you can walk to Pierre Herme on Rue Bonaparte). You can't go wrong by staying at the Hotel d'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in best area”
Reviews.Author: SCaron42
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel in every way. The staff was so acccommodating, and the hotel had 50% American tourists, not sure if that is a positive or a negative! The breakfast was amazing and served until 11:30 a.m. eggs, 5 breads, pastries, cheeses, French yogurts, fruits, cooked spinach, etc. This was a big plus for us in the a.m. There is a beautiful garden, that is covered in bad weather, where we had drinks before going out in the evening. The bar at Cafe Laurent was so lovely and comfortable, beautiful jazz music until midnight. A nice nightcap after our late nights in Paris. The manager, Flavien and bartender Arnod were wonderful and everyone speaks English good enough. The French appreciate it if you TRY to speak French, you are in France! The rooms were very comfortable, nice size bathroom for European standards, comfy bed, great treats in the room, flat screen tv (boring CNN, don't bother). dvd rentals if you are that boring and want to watch a movie in your room. The location is amazing. We walked everywhere. No need for a taxi. Our favorite restaurant is on the side street, which we could see from our room window on Rue Christine, called CHEZ FERNAND, serving traditional French cuisine, not pricey, and wonderful service. The French are very polite and everyone offers to help you in the cafes, stores, and hotels. We are New Yorkers, and a bit fussy, this place was a lot of bang for the buck. We loved it and can't wait to go back. What a beautiful city in every way, we highly recommend this lovely hotel, especially for American tourists who are not looking for an American high rise chain hotel. Fabulous place! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here Thursday through Saturday ”
Reviews.Author: ArianeDukas
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at Hotel d'Aubusson on Thursday, Friday or Saturday nights unless you really enjoy hearing loud jazz in your room until well past midnight. The hotel's live jazz band resonates at least up through the fourth floor and is painful on the first.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: spinesrgn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in June in a Deluxe room. Concierge was very helpful, making dinner reservations for each night via e-mail prior to our stay. Hotel is well maintained and up to four star standards in terms of amenities. Excellent location. We did have a couple of minor problems, however. On our first night (Satuday night I believe) there was live Jazz in the bar on the ground floor. Unfortunately, our first floor room was directly over the bar. The music was so loud that it felt as iff they were perfroming in our room. The performance lasted until 12:30 am despite several calls and visit in my bathrobe to the front desk. It would not have been so bad if we didn't have to wake up at the crack of dawn for our excursion to Normandy. To their benefit, they did send half a bottle of champaign to our room the next day. For some reason, however the bottle and the glasses were gone when we returned the next day.... very odd. Another night, my wife called down for some extra towels, when the front desk person arrived at the door with a single towel and was told we needed two, he became quite upset and nasty. Unfortunately, these two incidents put a bit of a damper on an otherwise pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon paradise”
Reviews.Author: MangoChutney
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon destination for the first 5 days and nights of our honeymoon. We booked the hotel after reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor and can only say a big thank you to all concerned because the hotel certainly lived up to the reviews. We booked the "Romance" package (surprise surprise as we were on honeymoon!) and would recommend this to all. We were in a superior room which was quiet, and although not spacious it did have a wonderful bed!! The service was exceptional throughout from the airport pick up in a new Mercedes (worth a lot especially as we were 2 hours late in landing due to a delay!) to the maid service which was exceptional. As part of our package we got free tickets to The Louvre, Seine river trip, Chamber music concerts and a fantastic Champagne dinner. Add on to this the Champagne and roses in the rom on arrival and it made for a great stay. We frequented the bar every evening (drinking mostly Champagne!) and whilst it is not cheap in my opinion it was worth it especially with free Jazz Thurs - Sun. The location is unbeatable and that in itself is worth lots - we walked everywhere - and it is in a lively street setting during the evening with great, well priced restaurants everywhere you looked. Has to be the best value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSAURORA
Reviews.Content: Very personable service...as helpful as you could imagine in making reservations at great restaurants ...perfect location....nicely decorated ...quiet...nice piano bar...even helped with a surprise presentation of champagne and chocolates for a celebration...best small hotel I have ever used

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stacims
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel d'Aubusson largely because of a very positive review from Frommer's and excellent reviews on this site. I am so glad I did. My husband and I were celebrating our first anniversary and wanted a smaller, boutique hotel on the left bank, and this was absolutely the best choice. First of all, the location can't be beat! There is so much to see and do in the area, and our feet ached because we walked everywhere! Even if you don't walk to walk as much, multiple metro stops are just steps away!. The restaurants around the area are fantastic - we really didn't need to walk more than a few blocks away for most dinners. The room (we booked a Standard room - it was room 402) was nice in size, not nearly as small as some of the rooms in European hotels I've stayed at in the past. It was very quiet even though it was on the "main" street side of the hotel. The decor was lovely and the bathroom was quite nice. The Hermes toiletries were a fantastic perk! While we did enjoy the room, the reason we loved the hotel so much was because of the staff. Every single person was kind, helpful, and really went above and beyond what was expected. From our e-mail questions before we arrived that we answered so promptly, to the receptionist/concierge going beyond what we'd expect by bringing us up to the room at check in to show it to us, to the reservations made whenever asked, to the map and directions for where we were driving the next day, the staff members did everything we asked them and more. We were so pleased with the level of service received at such a small hotel, and really felt that the staff cared so much about our us and our experience. I would highly recommend this hotel. We are already trying to convince my parents to stay there for their annviersary! The location, rooms, and especially the staff made our trip to Paris such a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, almost perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: M.Eleanor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day stay with the Romance package. The hotel is perfectly situated within walking / metro distance from everything in Paris. I was a student in Paris 10 years ago, so I knew St. Germain was the ideal central location. If you can afford it, go for the Romance package. While I did not visit any of the standard rooms, when posts say the room with the romance package is "big," that is by European standards. If one were paying $500 per night in the US, the square footage would certainly be doubled at the least. Regardless, the room looks exactly as pictured on the web site (though if my husband and I were given twin beds for the Romance package, as a previous post mentioned, I would have not been pleased -- good sleep with the Romance package?) The Hermes toiletries are truly fabulous. The shower / bathroom lovely, and the fresh flowers just perfect. The staff does a wonderful turndown, leaving little treats each evening (candies, pears, etc.), along with the forecast. The staff is delightful, helpful and multilingual. The airport pickup (or train station, in our case) was such a welcome relief to the planning process. Our champagne lunch in the courtyard was among our best lunch experiences in Paris. Other than the price, which one should expect for a European trip appeasing our American appetite for comfort (a/c, big rooms, etc), the main negatives at the hotel are truly minor. Those being: our room (210) was right by the kitchen. We are not early risers, so each morning, were were awakened by the sound of clattering dishes and the breakfast staff. Bottled water in the room is nearly 5 euro for .75 liters of Evian. (Though I probably would have dismissed this, except the hotel we just left in Amsterdam provided bottled water free of charge.) Also, the hotel bar is ridiculously expensive. 14 euro for a glass of champage? Nearly 18 euro for an after dinner coffee drink? It would be more appropriate to perhaps offer a discount to guests, plus, when the music begins, all tabs are subject to an additional charge. The dvd rental is also not free. These are 9 euro, and one has to go down to the desk to rent the dvd, or request room service (requiring a tip), so that's 15 USD. In all, the negatives are truly minior nit-picky things. We would still, most likely return to the hotel because of the location. And I would probably book the romance package again, as it is a better rate for the room category than what is published as the stand rate, yet it includes so much. It truly was a nice hotel with a fantastic staff, in an even better location. The difference, for me, between a four and five star rating rests with the details.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel needs some modernizing”
Reviews.Author: bretthodges
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Hotel D'Aubusson. It is in a fantastic location in the middle of St. Germain, and the rooms themselves are very quiet due to double windows. Breakfast is super - served in a gorgeous old, tapestry lined room on the ground floor. Staff are very friendly and multi-lingual. I did a lot of research choosing a small, left-bank hotel, and unfortunately was a little disappointed by the D'Aubusson. Not that it was terrible in any way, but it just lacked the flair and attention to detail that some other small European city hotels have - notably the Widder Hotel in Zurich. This was most easily seen in the barely functional bathroom fixtures - shower fixtures barely worked in both of our rooms, sinks had minimal water pressure. I got the feeling that the fixtures haven't been really looked at, and certainly not replaced, since the hotel opened several decades ago. Not fatal flaws by any means, and the friendliness and terrific location make the hotel a decent choice. I just think that the next time we visit Paris we'll try the Relais Christine (a hundred feet away) as a Parisian friend said it was better than the D'Aubusson. From the outside it certainly looks more charming.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok, but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: longboard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, but not great, staff was good but not 5 star level, rooms were clean and large, beds were very average. They provided a couple free laptops in the lobby which was nice, they had a nice bar but it was very pricey. We were there 7 nights and got a free fruit basket and jar of olives, no champagne. It was a very good boutique hotel but seemed over priced, and hard to figure how this is the #1 hotel in Paris. Its not a bad place, but not spectacular. We stayed in 2 hotels in Paris, both were similar but the d'Aubusson was much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome”
Reviews.Author: meyers720
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleD_31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for the first week of March this year and after MUCH research utilizing this site and others, I booked this hotel. What a treat! We booked the Romance package which included an airport transfer (via Mercedes), tickets to the Louvre, and several other perks! We were upgraded 2 levels to a suite room on the top floor upon check-in and were so pleased with the room, the treats that were left for us each day in our room, the fabulous housekeeping and Hermes toiletries, the wonderful included breakfast, and the giant fireplace in the parlor that was always lit and so warm and inviting. The hotel also had a great bar with a live jazz band Thurs.-Sat. and a beautiful outside courtyard. The service was impeccable throughout the hotel. Location - not to be beat! Hotel d'Aubusson is located within a fabulous labrynth of left bank streets. Two blocks from Point Neuf, Notre Dame, walking distance to everywhere (including the Louvre). Lots of great restaurants, cafe's, museums and shops all around the corner. Stay here if you get a chance! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: knoxvillegranny
Reviews.Content: My granddaughters and I went for seven days of Spring Break. The Winter Package allowed us to enjoy Paris despite cold rainy weather. GREAT hotel especially for a triple room. The staff all helped make our stay truly outstanding. Their recommendations for restaurants were terrific. We want to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Upperwestsider
Reviews.Content: Located two blocks from Pont Neuf and the Seine, Hotel D'Aubusson is Paris -- lovely, quiet, and tres elegant. The staff are warm and extremely helpful, guiding us to excellent area restaurants that were not too touristy, and helping set up a mini-van tour to Giverney, where the flowers were in full bloom ( a side trip well worth taking during the spring). Our room, while expensive, was worth the money. It was spacious by European standards, exceptionally well maintained and clean, and very comfortable. In the evenings, small groups gathered to listen to live jazz in the bar. Free internet connection is also available. The area is terrific, in every direction there's everything you could ask for - museums, cafes, shopping, markets, Ile de la Cite, the Louvre, the Seine, Jardin du Luxembourg, just to name a few. We can't wait to return to Paris and stay at this exceptional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel d"Aubusson is the greatest...”
Reviews.Author: RomyNJ
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 9 day stay at the Hotel d"Abusson in Paris and all I can say is it was marvelous. Its location in the Left bank was just perfect...the service we received was wonderful. The front desk staff was incredible helping us out in every way they could as we negotiated through our everyday adventures in Paris. Their help and recommendations were right on!!! The accomodations were better than we anticipated -- tastefully decorated, roomy (3 in the room) beds were very comfortable, hairdryer, a safe, and the bathroom was quite roomy and modern. We just loved the room service and the lovely everyday welcome touch of flowers, chocolates, candies, etc. Breakfast was good and plentiful and the parlors to relax were like being at home. The bar and jazz on the weekends was great! I would come again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the 6th Arr”
Reviews.Author: Trumphodge
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at the Angleterre on Rue Jacob when visiting Paris, but had been disappointed the last time. So I looked for other options in the same area and read about the d'Aubusson on this website. The reviews were not wrong--the d'Aubusson is a gem. We booked the Romance package and it delivered in a special way every day of our stay. We were in room 306, with twin beds (best for vacation sleep, I think). Quiet, of good size for Paris, great bathroom, wonderful linens. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The breakfast is wonderful. The champagne lunch, welcome champagne, roses, were wonderful. We took the river cruise but didn't go to the concert--although the choices were interesting. We always buy a museum pass in Paris, so didn't need the Louvre tickets, but decided to give them away to some young couple at the door. How fun to learn that the couple I approached were on their honeymoon! Oh, and the airport pickup was wonderful. And so was the jazz in the Cafe Laurent. You can hear it slightly in the room but it never went late. The package isn't cheap but it really delivers value. We would definitely return there. We recommend for dinner: Le Petit Zinc over by St Germain and the Sushi House down the block from the hotel. We got more delicious sushi than we could eat (plus salad and miso) and sake for 44 euros. Who says it's expensive to eat in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel d'Aubusson Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: SkiScuba
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a 9-night birthday stay with two girlfriends at the Hotel d'Aubusson, and it could not have been lovlier. The accommodations are beautiful, and they take great care to details . . . beautiful flower arrangements, candlight in the courtyard, flowers in the room, and a surprise gift in the room each night . . . I felt like I was staying in someone's home. The staff at the front desk were very accommodating and friendly. Jean, Verni, and the others were very helpful with making restaurant recommendations and reservations, calling for taxis and assisting with day-trip suggestions and plans. Jazz at night was entertaining, and the breakfast in the dining room was extremely relaxing and quite delicious. The hotel is in a perfect location on the left bank allowing for easy walking access to everything. If you want to stay on the left bank, this boutique hotel is quite a charmer.

Reviews.Title: “*priceless* just like the ad”
Reviews.Author: Cdloser
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 13-17, 2007 My daughter and I went to Paris for our birthday treats. Based on the reviews we booked at the d'Aubusson. What an absolute delight. We stayed in Room 114 and they gave us the 'Romance Package'. We had a beautiful boquet of roses on our arrival, sweets and fresh towels every evening, home baked brioche one evening, it just didn't stop.....oh and champange on ice. What a staff, I can't go on enough about the staff. They are so helpful and accomodating. Whatever our request and we had a few, they were there to help. We ate in a little cafe called Breakfast in American about 1/2 mile away maybe a mile but it worked off the calories. They found out where it was and got all the info for us. I loved the hotel and we both agree if we come again or bring our husbands .... this will be THE hotel. GREAT location and cozy and warm. Also our room was air conditioned and it was warm when we were there so I was very happy about that. It was nice and big and we could rent DVD's. Wonderful experience and it would be hard to choose which was lovelier the staff or the hotel. WONDERFUL!! As the commercial says 'Priceless'.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the D'aubusson”
Reviews.Author: Ralstonlan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the D'Aubusson and had a wonderful experience. We booked the Romance package which included airport pick-up and breakfast daily. Also included were tickets to the Louvre, which we did not use as we had the Museum Pass for five days. I did not know that the package also included a lunch, served either in our room, the outdoor terrace, or the lounge. We opted for our room as it gave us an opportunity to relax and put our feet up. The lunch consisted of a bottle of champagne, smoked salmon, shrimp, cheeses, sausages and breads. Just fabulous. Our room, number 106, was huge, even by American standards. A very comfortable king size bed, with plenty of room for a sofa and two chairs and table. The windows opened to a great view of the bustling Rue Dauphine, although at night it was extremely quiet. The entrance was a seperate hallway from the bedroom. Bath was large and comfortable. The Hermes bath products were a nice touch. We stopped in the Cafe Laurent one evening for after dinner drinks and had a wonderful evening of jazz. Some interesting characters in the bar! The location can't be beat. You can walk to the Metro in five minutes. You are at at the edge of the river Seine in seconds. All in all, a perfect five day stay. It all does come at a price though, especially given the decreasing value of the dollar. If the D'Aubusson is in your price range, do consider it, as it is a perfect setting for a wonderful stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jazz!!”
Reviews.Author: JKFParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in Paris celebrating our anniversary and stayed at the Hotel d'Aubusson. We had a wonderful experience!! The minute we arrived we were greeted with a smile and very prompt and professional service. The staff at the hotel were very courteous and helpful with all of our requests. The hotel provides jazz in the Cafe Laurent 6 nights a week and it is fabulous! We travel extensively in the states and in Europe and I was very happy with our decision to stay at this hotel. The excellent location, service, breakfast, jazz and size of our room were perfect for a quick weekend get-away! We had a superior room near the elevator and I was worried that we would hear a lot of noise but it was extremely quiet. We loved the large windows that opened up to rue Dauphine where you could hear all the action going on outside but when we closed the windows it was absolutely sound proof! The area around the hotel includes many great little shops, cafes and chocolate boutiques! We had dinner at the trendy Alain Ducasse restaurant Spoon, close to the Champs-Elysees and also Guy Savoy's Les Bouquinistes, located very close to the hotel. We also went to the chic hot spot Le Cafe Marly at the Louvre for the best people watching! I would highly recommend all three restaurants but definitely make reservations for Fri/Sat evenings. It's hard to come back to reality after such an incredible trip to Paris but we will return to the Hotel d'Aubusson soon!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: EuroHoneymoon2006
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel so I will summarise: Reception staff - Great, nothing too much trouble Cafe Laurent lounge - Excellent, relaxing atmosphere, great place for a coffee after a long day before dinner Room - Incredible. See photos Location - Could not have been better I knew nothing about Paris before I went on honeymoon with my wife in November. Now I just want to go back. This hotel made Paris everything that I dreamed it could be. Although the weather was a bit cold and a bit rainy (we had one clear day in the 4 days we were there), the hotel made it that much easier. Staying in the Latin Quarter is an absolute must in Paris. There were literally 30 or 40 restaurants/cafes/bistro within a 5 minute walk of the hotel, all of an excellent standard (contact us for recommendations if you like). The hotel is also 5 minutes walk from 2 metro stations, Place St Michel and Odeon (St Michel is closer) so getting around is a breeze (buy a Paris Visite card if travelling on a budget for unlimited public transport). The best thing about the hotel location is you are 100m from Pnt Neuf, and onyl 10 minutes walk to the Louvre. If you book the romance package, Louvre tickets are included which made a big difference. The room is spacious, the bed is dreamy comfortable and the bathroom was huge! We stayed on the romance package which is one of their large rooms. If you are coming here for romance, find the money to stay at this hotel, I cannot tell you how good it is. Please contact us if you want more details, I could go on forever about how good this hotel is.....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: irn73
Reviews.Content: My wife recently returned from a 5 night stay at Hotel D' Aubusson. From the minute we walked into the beautiful lobby we loved it. We have stayed in many top notch hotels in Paris and and this was by far the best. Great service and great room. It is a bit of a splurge but worth every cent. We especially liked the exposed beamed ceilings throughout and the great fireplace in the breakfast room. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SigridH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the D'Aubusson for five nights in early December '06. The hotel is charming. Our room overlooked the street and was absolutely clean and soundproof (with windows closed). We slept well. The staff was friendly and fantastic. I thought I had lost my passport and Alexandra accompanied us to the local police station and got directions to the US Embassy for a duplicate (I found original right where I had tucked it inside rented cellphone case when packing to go home). Sophie mailed three books to our home in the U.S. that were left at the front desk of the hotel. The location is great--tons of interesting little shops all around, and good walks in every direction. Enjoy! Martha H. (Chicago)

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but perfect”
Reviews.Author: BevJones
Reviews.Content: Everything about this converted XVII chateau was pleasing: room, staff, public space, jazz bar, courtyard, breakfast and location. The hotel is two blocks from the Odeon transportation hub, but many major sites, like the Louvre, D'Orsay, Seine, Notre- Dame are easy walks. Deux Magots, a great people- watching hangout, is about four blocks away. Rue St. Andre des Arts, a walking street with dozens of restaurants, is just a few short blocks away. Toiletries were Hermes and extra goodies, flowers, candy, fruit or wine, arrived almost daily. I did find the hotel quite expensive. About $200 more per night than the nice three star hotels that I usually reserve. The price was my only reservation about the d'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for a Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wtbush
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel d'Aubusson from September 6, 2005 to September 15, and couldn't be happier with it. If you've checked the map, you'll see how perfectly located it is, in Latin Quarter almost St. Germaine. Pont Neuf, connecting the nearby Louvre, Marais etc, is only two short blocks away. There are tons of restaurants and shops within a few blocks. It's so centrally located that we only used the metro once- we walked everywhere. The hotel is on Rue Dauphine, which is a nice street with an interesting mix of shops. The neighborhood is great for strolling- cafes, pastries, and a great little counterculture book/comic shop down the block called Librairie ActualitÃ©s. Continuing down gets you to the Buci area, which is always jumping. A few more blocks and you're at Le Deux Magots, Cafe De Flor, and Brasserie Lipp. Go the other way and you're on the bridge admiring the Eiffel tower as you head to the right bank. The hotel feels classy and elegant from the time you come into the lobby, and the Cafe Laurent is a fine bar to have a drink or snack, or listen to some great jazz. There are two internet computers, one in the cafe and right on the street so you can surf and people watch at the same time. Our room was initially the Edith Piaf room, 507, I think. We were on the well discounted Romance package, as it was my wife's 50th birthday and our anniversary. The room was large and well appointed. However, we suddenly realized that some of our favorite times while in hotels abroad were when we could throw open the windows and see the streetscape. 507 is well removed from the street, and very quiet. We felt isolated, and debated whether to complain that the room was *too* quiet! Finally we called and they were fine with showing us another Deluxe, and comparable, room. The next one was about the same, and by now we were feeling pretty guilty, but the reception clerk, Jenny, was extremely gracious. As we came around to realizing what we wanted, and were almost resigned to a big quiet room (!), we explained to her, she made a call, and showed us a Superior room, just a notch down in size. It was room 204 and it was perfect. We walked in and there were two French doors that had two windows behind them with a tiny 'balcony' (not really, just a foot or two of landing and a rail). Finding just what we wanted, we threw open the windows and enjoyed the bustle of the street. It was like sitting at a cafe peoplewatching. Not to worry, the two sets of windows with the air gap were virtually hermetically sealed when closed, and you cannot hear a thing. For us, 201-204 are the best of both worlds, quiet plus a little street action, and we were fine with a slightly smaller room. The staff couldnt' have been more helpful. They were always smiling, accommodated every request graciously. A distinctive mark of an excellent hotel (or organization), is how they deal with challenges. D'Aubusson rose to it by showing us several rooms and finding what we wanted. Additionally, when a mistake was made with the laundry service, they made good on it the only way possible, by paying for the pants. No argument, no explanation, just a sincere apology and a generous credit. The bartender at Cafe Laurent (Flavienne I believe) is fun to hang out with, and the place has its own following. Use the staff for recommendations. They know the area. Avoid the restaurant row nearby where the hawkers practically steer you into their establishments, and either scope out a place in advance, or tell the staff your preferences. Be careful scoping in advance, as there's a big difference in some latin quarter streets for ambience in dining between daytime and night. The staff arranged our Romance Package amenities very well- Louvre tickets, Seine boat cruise, classical concert, car pickup, and of course the champagne, fruit, brioche, and gift. They also got us anniversary lunch reservations at Jules Verne in the Eiffel Tower, which until the next day was the best meal we'd ever had. They also arranged our anniversary dinner the next day at a restaurant a block away called Jacques Cagna. We had no idea if the staff was good at picking special restaurants, and wowwwwww. It was spectactular, and the perfect special occasion place. We enjoy quality gourmet restaurants occasionally, and this place topped our top places in San Francisco and Italy. Thank god we took out the second mortgage on the house! But sometimes, you do something off the charts and it leaves an indelible memory for life, which is exactly why you splurged. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent. Yes a bit pricey but what a spread; and we didn't care since it was included in the rate. The breakfast room is lovely, there's another room next to it if you want to move around, and in good weather, there's a courtyard for breakfast or drinks and snacks. The kitchen staff will make any breakfast dish you request, so if continental isnt' your style, have it your way. We typically use Tripadvisor to find hotels. We look for the highest ranking hotel within our criteria, which is usually at least 3 star, dead center location, not ridiculously expensive, and no recent Tripadvisor comments about lack of cleanliness. We tend to throw out the best and worst reviews, chalking them off to people that love everything or people with 'travel issues', respectively. Curious about our hotel choice, we went around the corner and checked out Relais Christine, which our hotel advised us is a friend of theirs, not so much a rival. Relais Christine had some beautiful features, such as the spa and charming cavelike dining arear. A few rooms even had a patio. However, all in all, we preferred D'Aubusson's location on a more interesting street, the Cafe, and our room furnishings. It was a great experience at the D'Aubusson, and deserves its very high Tripadvisor marks.

Reviews.Title: “D'Aubusson is Charming and Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: LyonDuck
Reviews.Content: We booked two standard rooms at the Hotel D'Aubusson the last week of August, (room numbers 201 and 202). We could not have been happier with the stay there. I work for a global company and have stayed at Fairmonts, Ritz's, Mandarin's, Hyatt's and etc.....so I am familiar with good service. I spent a considerable amount of time trying to decide on the right hotel because I wanted my children to come away with a memorable experience of Paris. I have also stayed at other Parisian hotels like the Regina and the Hotel Lutettia and wasn't all that impressed. The location near Odeon could not be better. You are in the heart of the latin quarter and only a couple of blocks from Pont Neuf bridge. There are restaurants galore around you ,including L'Entrecote St Germain, which the kids loved. The Hotel D'Aubusson provides a clean, quiet hotel room with a fantastic staff. Our Summer Promotion package included airport pickup, breakfast and various vouchers for the Louvre and Seine cruises. Our driver was waiting for us as we got through crazy baggage claim area of CDG. The hotel provided gifts and turn down service at night. Laurent, the jazz bar located off the lobby is a nice place to hang out and catch emails through wifi. The breakfast includes a wide assortment of cheeses, eggs, breads, fruits, cereals etc. Even though it was included in our package, I still think it would be worth paying 15 to 20 euros for. If you want a big American style hotel, go to the right bank and run with the masses. If you want intimate type stay where the clerks wave and acknowledge you (in building that dates back to the 1600's), check the D'Aubusson. If you are not over critical of European style accommodations, you will enjoy your stay as much as we did. Our experience lived up to the high rating that Trip Advisor provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: loloa312
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel. The rooms were nice and luxurious, the employees were extremley friendly, and the hotel lobby and sitting rooms were so cute and quaint. The area was perfect, surrounded by great cafes, bars, and nightlife. I stronglly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DHLJP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights in June and loved the Hotel' D'Aubusson. Our adult son also joined us for the last two nights. so we had a loft apartment which worked really well for the three of us. The room was spacious, with a sitting room and separate bedroom in the loft, and the bathroom was well-appointed. Having read other reviewers comments regarding breakfast, we chose to eat breakfast elsewhere. The location is excellent - in a couple of minutes we could be at the Louvre or Notre Dame or on Ile St. Louis eating Berthillon ice cream! What really set the hotel apart was the staff in the reception area -- they were really helpful and very friendly. While on our next trip to Paris we might be tempted to stay in another area of the city, I believe we will probably return to the D'Aubusson.

Reviews.Title: “Meets the Reviews Exactly”
Reviews.Author: slogdog
Reviews.Content: The D'Aubusson was exactly what was reviewed by trip advisors. Yes, the hotel is older, somewhat outdated in decor, but really exceptional otherwise. The location is what made this hotel such a superb find. Located just up the street from the Le Buci market area and St. Germain des Pres was such a wonderful experience. The staff all spoke english really well, seemed to really care about your hospitality and needs. They called for a taxi to take us across town, had resturant suggestion and more. I needed a 3 prong to 2 prong european adapter that the were more than pleased to provide. The bathrooms were great, clean and large from european standards, and to room (507) was very large and well air conditioned which was a welcome releif from the abnormally hot days in Paris. We got a deal from their website that gave us a chauffer from CDG and they were so kind even when our flight was delayed an hour from ATL. The driver was waiting for us and all smiles and very very nice. A welcome pack included water in the back of the car for our ride to the hotel from the airport with points of intrest located along the way in a nicely worded brouchure. A really nice touch. Yes the had spectular service every night including chocolates, cookies and other treats everynight. A card with the forcast for the next day was put on your pillow for the the turn-down service. The service was really really nice. We were able to walk to every place we wanted to go. Muse Cluny, St Sulpice, St. Severn, Louvre, Muse D'Orsay, Notre Dame, St Michele, St Germain, Tons of resturants and bistros, boulongeries little shops everywhere, It was overwhelming. I can't say enough about the location. As part of our package we had breakfast every morning the food was good, but it was the same everyday and we got a little tired of the same menu, but still the quality was really good but for a 10 day stay just got a little boring. Everyone has different tastes and I can see why some people were not as overwhelmed as others by this hotel. It was really a 4 star hotel in our opinion, where I can see that some would rate this hotel as a 3 star everyone is different. I'm sure there are more palacial, more american like, or more updated, but if you want a quality boutique hotel with attentive friendly staff, clean and large rooms, with nice bathrooms, great maid service, and adequate and plentiful breakfast, a nice bar and patio area, good free internet access, plush robes and slippers for your stay with oversized bath towles, and above all a location that is next to impossible to beat then you will love this hotel. Don't expect over the top luxury epecially if you are used to staying at the 4 seasons etc. We stayed for 10 days and loved it so much and loved Paris so much we booked another week for this september and we are bringing more family members so we are booking 3 rooms the next time. It was that good for all things mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: HSnell
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible stay at the Hotel d'Abusson. We arrived in Paris with several challenges (delayed flight, lost luggage, airport tranportation snag). As first time visitors to Paris, the hotel staff made us feel very welcome and assured us they would assist with located our luggage by contacting the airline. They did so and had our luggage delivered to our room the next morning. We opted to stay the first three nights in the Deluxe Room, taking advantage of the Romance Package. The package was inclusive of many amenities, all of which were arranged for by the hotel staff. The deluxe room was very nice and comfortable, complete with Hermes toiletries and flat screen TV. After the third day, we chose to move to a more affordable, standard room. The room was also very nice, and fairly similar in size (not too big, not too small). The bed wasn't quite as nice, but the room was just as comfortable and clean. Both rooms were very quiet (not a lot of hotel or street noise). The staff provided anything we asked for and were extremely accomadating. I don't feel the breakfast was worth 23 Euros/pp, but it was included the first three nights as part of the package. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and rate it as one of the friendliest places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review of Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: We were not as enamored of this hotel as other Trip Advisor members, perhaps because we switched from a modern, upscale hotel to this much older hotel for some preplanned variety. Upon arrival, we asked at the desk for a quiet room and were given one of the three rooms in a separate building called La Pavillon. True to its billing, the room was very quiet at night because it did not overlook the main street. However, the room itself was just slightly above average with rather bland decor on the walls, a sagging bed, and a bathroom door handle that came off easily. Housekeeping was a bit hit or miss - nothing critical, just things that could have been better for the 280 Euros per night Standard Room rate. Some days were fine; others not so great. Front desk staff was nice and helpful. Hotel bar (Cafe Laurent) had live jazz on Saturday night, and there is an adjacent, elegantly furnished salon with large fireplace and ceiling beams. Breakfast buffet is available in morning for 23 Euros (plus 7 for coffee), but it offers no more than many full service American hotels include with the room price. Better to go out to one of many patissieries in the area (like Le Buci). Hotel is centrally located on the busy west side of the 6th arrondissement, on the Left Bank, just south of Pont Neuf... and has easy access to Metro (Odeon) and RER stations (Place St. Michel). Great Italian restaurant within several blocks - Le Restaurant Marco Polo. Highly recommended. Another very good restaurant within walking distance was Perraudin, a block away from the Pantheon, at 157 rue Saint-Jacques. Have the beef bourguignon, and pay extra for a side order of potatoes au gratin. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: flyiad
Reviews.Content: Past reviews are very accurate. We spent 3 nights in 2 rooms at the D'Aubusson in late December and everyone was very happy with the accomodations. We had rooms in both the new and old part of the hotel. Even the smaller rooms at this hotel are larger than the norm in Paris. Everything was very clean, nice Hermes toiletries were replenished as needed, large (though firm) beds, lots of closet space, plenty of towels and two robes, flat screen TV/DVD players (not sure if these are in all rooms?) and very well soundproofed. Great location for St. Germain, the Seine, Louvre, D'Orsay, Notre Dame, Cluny, etc., and just a few blocks (4 or 5) from the St Michel Metro. In all cases the staff was friendly and helpful, whether at the desk, breakfast, bar, or cleaning. Even though we were in smoking rooms (and don't smoke) there was absolutely no smoky residue or odor. Winter promotion rates where $1 = 1 Euro, including breakfast, 1 day museum pass, champagne, and other amenities make things a bit more affordable. Breakfast was good but not lavish, (eggs, sausage, toast, pastries, juices, yogurt, cheese, coffee, tea, etc) certainly enough to get your day started, and acceptable when included in the room rate. Minor issues that made me wish for a 4.5 rating category: Some stains on the light colored carpet in one room (but the room did feel very clean despite this), and a few mildew stains on the shower grout in an otherwise completely spotless bathroom. The rooms were very hot - we turned off the heating entirely and had the windows open a lot of the time. In some ways it's nice to come back to a warm cozy room after spending the day in 40 degree temps, but if you like to sleep cold, it means having windows open and resulting street noise. The street noise is completely silenced by the double windows otherwise. Overall a great experience - we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler9
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in Paris! Unfortunately, now that the value of the dollar has sunk into the sewer, the price is a bit out of reach for most Americans. However, if you're a CEO and money is no object because your stockholders are paying for your trip to Paris, definitely check out this hotel. Every room I've stayed in has been different and delightful in its own way. The service is good, in any language, no matter which languages you speak. The rooms are so quiet and peaceful, that one can forget that this location is in the middle of one of the most exciting area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service at the Hotel d'Aubusson”
Reviews.Author: SMTORD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 7-night stay at the Hotel d'Aubusson. We opted for a "grand luxe loft" room, offered in their "Winter Promotion", where 1 Euro= 1 USD. The location of the hotel is ideal, two blocks from the Seine and a few more to Blvd. St. Germaine. The street runs right into the Pont Neuf, but for the most part we heard almost no street noise whatsoever. Our room was #406, one of the larger rooms, with 2 beds together, probably in total the width of an American King but shorter.... As we are both over 6' tall, they were definitely too short and this was an annoyance. The mattresses are typically Parisian.. hard... but the linens are very high-quality. There was a small sitting area, with a round table and 2 chairs, and plenty of room to walk around and store luggage. The bathroom was quite large, and well appointed with terry robes, Hermes toiletries, and all the towels you could use. The housekeeping staff are very diligent, and the room was spotless. The public areas are quite attractive, and the "Bar Laurent" has a great jazz group playing Thurs., Fri.and Sat. evenings. Breakfast is okay, not wonderful nor worth the 23 Euro tab if not included in the room rate. Service in the breakfast room is quite good, and they will make excellent omelettes for an extra charge. The gentleman who runs the bar and "sitting room" in the evenings is just fantastic... he treats the whole first floor as his fiefdom and makes sure everybody is well-serviced. The real test of this hotel occurred when on day 2 of our stay, I somehow contracted a serious GI problem (food poisoning, most likely) which necessitated getting a doctor to the hotel, prescriptions delivered, etc. The entire staff could not have been nicer of more helpful to us... they were absolutely wonderful. That the desk staff spoke such wonderful English was a real help in communicating the needs we had. When I emerged a couple days later, everyone inquired how I was, asked if there was anything I needed, and doted on us with genuine care and concern. We would have liked to stay at one of the "Leading Hotels of the World" in Paris, as we usually do in other European cities. Paris is just so insanely expensive, and the dollar now so weak, that we couldn't justify those prices. While we might have had beds more suitable to us, I doubt that we would have experienced better service than we we had at the d'Aubusson. The entire staff is a "family" of genuinely helpful and caring people. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location on the left bank, just two blocks from the Seine river. Staff friendly and attentive to guests needs. Located on quiet street, but within walking distance of good restaurants and nightlife. Rooms were clean and good size for European standards. Located 4 blocks from St. Michel subway and train station, where you can catch a train/subway anywhere in or around Paris. Good location to walk to most tourist destinations in Paris, ie: museums, Eiffel tower( a bit of a jaunt), Notre Dame, etc... Hotel was a pleasure for my first visit to Paris, I look forward to returning to the Hotel D'Aubusson.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel d'Aubusson
HotelInfo.Address: 33 Rue Dauphine | 06 Arr., 75006 Paris, France
